Title: MLops Engineer
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Skills: MLOps, Python, Computer Vision, Linux, Git
Description: About the job Responsibilities We are looking for qualified MLops Engineer for the eKYC project, who will help us build up our digital identity verification products. Your primary focus will be: MLOps: Apply MLOps techniques to optimize the AI model development process such as model serving, data/model versioning, autoML, and so on. Developing and managing the backend system which encapsulates and provides control flow of various ML models. Monitor and optimize system performance and resource consumption. Integrate ML models and ensure consistency in model interfaces and interaction as per product requirements. Act as interfaces between product team, engineering team, data science and infrastructure teams to ensure smooth integration of ML solutions. Modeling: Developing various ML models in the field of computer vision and implementing novel solutions for diverse ML problems (supervised, semi-supervised, unsupervised, one-class). Optimize and deploy "tiny" ML solutions on limited computation power devices such as mobile devices and web platforms. Requirements BS/MS in computer science or related fields Having 1 years of experience in Data science and MLOps Must be proficient in software design and software development. Must be proficient in Python, scripting language. Experience with other programming languages (C++, Java, Javascript ...) is a plus Must be proficient in Linux system, version control system (Git), virtualization and SW packaging tool (docker) Great communication skills Desired Skills: Experience with ML framework: Tensorflow, Pytorch, Mxnet, ONNX, Pandas, Numpy, kuberflow pipeline, airflow Experience with managing data science and computer vision toolkit, such as JupyterHub, OpenCV... is a plus Experience with Cloud Storage, CICD/Github workflows and Triton server are big pluses Experience with working with databases and query language is a plus. Familiar with MLOPs concept and toolkit is a plus Basic understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms BS/MS in Computer Science with focus on machine learning is a plus Your opportunity Have an opportunity to: Work under supervision of experts/leaders with more than 15 years of experience Focus on your technical development skills and build the career in data science Experience diverse types of AI problems including detection, classification, regression, OCR, LLM, abnormal detection, NLP, generative models) Experience a practical AI development pipeline and monitor AI systems in production: business requirement analysis, problem clarification, solution design, implementation, AI system testing, deployment, system monitoring and analysis. Develop features for applications of digital identity verification products, fraud prevention, and anti-money laundering, which are hot topics in recent years. Learn from production across many nations (Vietnam, Philippines, India, Indonesia) Work closely with the product team, infrastructure team, engineering team Understand the other related areas. Improve your social skills including communication, negotiation, cross-team collaboration, self-awareness and so on. What We Offer Competitive compensation package, including 13th-month salary and performance bonuses Comprehensive health care coverage for you and your dependents Generous leave policies, including annual leave, sick leave, and flexible work hours Convenient central district 1 office location, next to a future metro station Onsite lunch with multiple options, including vegetarian Grab for work allowance and fully equipped workstations Fun and engaging team building activities, sponsored sports clubs, and happy hour every Thursday Unlimited free coffee, tea, snacks, and fruit to keep you energized An opportunity to make a social impact by helping to democratize credit access in emerging markets. About Us We are an AI Fintech company specialized in assessing credit profiles of consumers in emerging markets combining pioneering AI with large alternative data sources. In 2020 we reached our ambitious milestone of credit profiling 1 billion consumers spanning 4 countries - Vietnam, Indonesia, India & the Philippines - and building a platform for the wider industry and the financial services industry, in particular, to provide the "un & under" served access to credit. At the core of this initiative has been our strict and unwavering adherence to the norms of consumer data privacy and consumer data rights. But we're not satisfied as we embark on the next leg of our journey to deliver 100 million credit lines to consumers in the markets where we operate. Although this goal is ambitious, we truly believe that by harnessing the power of AI & Big Data we can deliver financial access at an unprecedented scale. As a firm, we're audacious problem-solvers motivated by our impact on society. We deeply espouse the values of ownership - of our actions and initiatives, integrity in all we do, and agility in execution. We place great importance on doing what is right, what is best, and what is innovative. If you are smart, driven, and want to make a difference in the world with the most advance and fascinating technology, come join our team. We can satisfy your desire to explore new territory and give you the runway to really make an impact. Additional Info Learn more about us here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=inAEDGvOcL8&t=29s

Title: Full-stack Developer (Lập trình web)
Salary: Thu nhập thương lượng và cạnh tranh
Skills: Python, GCP, API, ReactJS, SQL
Description: About the job JOB DESCRIPTION Thiết kế và phát triển các hệ thống web/app ứng dụng tích hợp AI theo yêu cầu . Tích hợp và phát triển các mô hình AI/ML thông qua Vertex AI để giải quyết các bài toán nghiệp vụ theo yêu cầu khách hàng. Phát triển các API backend mạnh mẽ và có khả năng mở rộng bằng cách sử dụng các ngôn ngữ lập trình như Node.js hoặc Python, và triển khai chúng trên các dịch vụ Cloud của GCP như Cloud Run, Cloud Functions hoặc App Engine. Làm việc với các hệ quản trị cơ sở dữ liệu (SQL và NoSQL) như Cloud SQL (PostgreSQL/MySQL), Firestore, MongoDB để thiết kế schema, tối ưu hóa truy vấn và quản lý dữ liệu cho các ứng dụng AI. Tham gia vào toàn bộ vòng đời phát triển phần mềm, từ phân tích yêu cầu, thiết kế kiến trúc AI-driven, phát triển, kiểm thử, triển khai đến bảo trì các giải pháp. Tham gia vào tự động hóa việc triển khai ứng dụng trên Cloud (CI/CD). Nghiên cứu và áp dụng các công nghệ AI và Cloud mới nhất để liên tục cải thiện và đổi mới sản phẩm. REQUIREMENTS Bằng cấp Đại học Công nghệ Thông tin hoặc tương đương.. Có chứng chỉ Google Cloud Professional Certified là điểm cộng. Tối thiểu 3 năm kinh nghiệm lập trình web Thành thạo Python (Flask hoặc FastAPI), biết cách tổ chức backend đơn giản Có kinh nghiệm React: đủ để xây dựng UI mới hoặc chỉnh sửa theo yêu cầu Đã từng triển khai project thực tế (demo, POC hoặc MVP) cho khách hàng Có khả năng deploy local/test/prod: dùng GCP, Firebase, Docker hoặc các nền tảng tương đương Kỹ năng debug, đọc log, xử lý lỗi kết nối, API, môi trường Ưu tiên từng làm việc ở các đội R&D, startup, hoặc sản phẩm AI/Cloud BENEFITS Thu nhập thương lượng và cạnh tranh căn cứ theo năng lực. Các khoản hỗ trợ: ăn trưa, máy tính, điện thoại, gửi xe,... Thưởng: Thưởng Lễ, Tết, Thưởng kinh doanh, Thưởng lợi nhuận, Thưởng dự án, Thưởng KPI, Commission,...tùy theo mỗi vị trí Chế độ nâng lương: đánh giá, điều chỉnh 1 lần/ năm. Được tham gia BHXH, BHYT, BHTN đầy đủ theo quy định của pháp luật Phúc lợi khác: Bảo hiểm sức khỏe GMS-care; Khám sức khỏe định kỳ; Du lịch; Teambuilding, ... Thời gian làm việc: Thứ 2 đến thứ 6 hàng tuần. Nghỉ phép: tối thiểu 12 ngày phép/năm, chính sách nghỉ phép tăng thêm theo level Phát triển nghề nghiệp: Cơ hội tham gia các khóa đào tạo chuyên môn được cấp chứng chỉ CNTT Quốc tế miễn phí; tiếp cận những công nghệ mới nhất; Cơ hội tham gia các dự án với các đối tác lớn và cộng tác với những chuyên gia hàng đầu; Cơ hội khẳng định năng lực bản thân và thăng tiến trong sự nghiệp. Được làm việc trong môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp, năng động, sáng tạo, cởi mở và tôn trọng.

Title: [HN] Learning & Development Business Partner (Junior)
Skills: Communication & Interpersonal Skills, Design, Project Management, Team Management, English
Description: About the job Base.vn - nền tảng số “Make in Vietnam ”, được biết đến là một trong những công ty đi đầu trong lĩnh vực xây dựng nền tảng quản trị doanh nghiệp Software-as-a-Service uy tín, đã vinh hạnh phục vụ hơn 10.000 Doanh Nghiệp SMEs và giúp họ giải quyết những nỗi đau khi vận hành doanh nghiệp trong nhiều lĩnh vực với nhiều quy mô khác nhau như VIB, SCB, Bamboo, Vincommerce, Tomorrow Marketers, Hoozing, Vissan, Yody, VNExpress, CafeBiz … Tháng 10/2023, Base vinh dự là đơn vị ICT duy nhất chiến thắng hạng mục Doanh nghiệp xuất sắc châu Á Thái Bình Dương - APEA 2023 , đồng thời cũng là đơn vị nền tảng quản trị đầu tiên từng chiến thắng hạng mục giải thưởng này tại Việt Nam trong 16 năm qua. Với sự phát triển thần tốc trong những năm qua và không dừng lại trong việc chiếm lĩnh thị trường Việt Nam, Base còn muốn vươn xa hơn tới các thị trường khu vực trong những năm sắp tới. Chúng tôi đang tìm kiếm các nhân tố trẻ tài năng , đầy khát vọng và có tầm nhìn dài hạn để đồng hành trong hành trình sắp tới. Customer Success là bộ phận được ví như "Trái tim của ngành SaaS" - nơi tiếp nối trải nghiệm và giá trị của khách hàng trên mọi sản phẩm dịch vụ của Base thông qua việc cung cấp dịch vụ CSKH xuất sắc và tư vấn up/cross-sell, gia hạn Hợp đồng. Từ đó, giúp hàng nghìn khách hàng doanh nghiệp chuyển đổi số thành công và đem lại nguồn doanh thu bền vững cho Base. Với phương châm "People First", Khối Customer Success mong muốn tìm kiếm bạn người đồng hành trong việc phát triển nhân sự và văn hóa nội bộ cho Khối, đồng thời, đảm bảo các công việc của Khối được vận hành trơn tru nhất. 1. Công việc cụ thể: 1.1. Đào tạo phát triển & Quản trị hiệu suất nhân sự nội bộ Khối (70%) (1) L&D Xây dựng kế hoạch & vận hành đào tạo (thiết kế slide & hoạt động đào tạo, truyền thông đào tạo, đánh giá hiệu quả đào tạo) cho nhân sự trong Khối, gồm: Onboarding Training: Trực tiếp đứng lớp onboarding cho nhân sự mới, nội dung: Sản phẩm & Quy trình làm việc nội bộ (khi có phát sinh) Skillset Training: Vận hành lớp cùng Trainer nội bộ (định kỳ theo nhu cầu) Sharing Series: Vận hành lớp học (hàng tuần) Contest: Xây dựng và vận hành các chương trình thi đua lớn của khối (hàng Quý). Tham khảo thêm CX Innovation Challenge. Kiểm tra, đánh giá năng lực định kỳ cho nhân sự khối (hàng quý/năm) Cập nhật khung năng lực nhân sự các bộ phận (nếu cần) Lên kế hoạch, kiểm soát chi phí đào tạo. (2) Performance Management Triển khai hoạt động quản trị mục tiêu & đánh giá kết quả thực hiện mục tiêu hàng năm/quý/tháng cho bộ phận trên app Base Goal/Base Review Thực hiện báo cáo kết quả theo yêu cầu của Giám đốc khối. 1.2. Xây dựng văn hóa nội bộ (20%) Xây dựng, điều phối các hoạt động nội bộ (team building, sinh nhật, sum-up, ...) nhằm nâng cao tinh thần, gắn kết nhân sự với nhau Phối hợp các khối và bộ phận khác, đảm bảo việc điều phối nhân sự khối theo sát và thực hiện tốt các hoạt động/chương trình chung của công ty. 1.3. Hỗ trợ bộ phận (10%) Các công việc vận hành khác của Khối theo yêu cầu phát sinh 2. Chân dung ứng viên phù hợp: (1) Yêu cầu về kinh nghiệm: Từ 1 năm kinh nghiệm L&D hoặc vận hành hoặc admin, ưu tiên có kinh nghiệm tại các startup công nghệ Ưu tiên có kinh nghiệm làm việc với các hệ thống / phần mềm quản trị công việc/dự án (2) Năng lực cần có: Communication & Interpersonal Skills: giao tiếp tốt, có khả năng lắng nghe chủ động Design: thành thạo công cụ thiết kế (Canva, PPT, ....) Design thinking: Tư duy giải quyết vấn đề Adaptability: Có khả năng thích nghi nhanh với sự thay đổi nhanh chóng của môi trường startup Multi-tasking: Có khả năng làm việc đa nhiệm (3) Thái độ: Chủ động, quyết liệt, có thể làm việc độc lập và chịu được áp lực cao Tư duy tích cực, luôn tìm kiếm các giải pháp để giải quyết các vấn đề hàng ngày thay vì tìm lý do đổ lỗi. Cẩn thận, tỷ mỉ & chỉn chu Mong muốn gắn bó lâu dài 3. Quyền lợi của bạn: Thu nhập: 9,000,000 - 10,000,000 VND + bonus theo quý Bảo hiểm sức khỏe FPTCare cho nhân sự từ 1 năm làm việc Có đội ngũ L&D giàu kinh nghiệm chuyên môn hỗ trợ Được làm việc và học tập trong môi trường công ty dựa trên tư duy hệ thống, data driven Môi trường trẻ, lành mạnh, đồng nghiệp supportive, nhiều cá nhân xuất sắc Văn hóa học tập và phát triển mạnh mẽ, xuất bản tri thức & chia sẻ kiến thức thông qua các hoạt động learning, training, sharing, ... & mạng xã hội tri thức nội bộ Base Square Nhiều hoạt động gắn kết nội bộ: CLB đọc sách, CLB thể thao: Base Runners, Base FC, CLB cầu lông, tennis, trekking, ... 4. Title: Software Engineer II - Golang
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Skills: Golang, PHP, Software Architecture, Networking, English
Description: About the job ZALORA Engineering is looking for software engineers to work on the backend services that power the mobile apps. Join us in building our high traffic site serving millions of customers per month throughout Southeast Asia. You will be exposed to a polyglot architecture, modern development workflows, and a forward-thinking team dedicated to solving the big-picture problems in e-commerce. As a member of the mobile backend team, you will hack on the mobile API and a portfolio of microservices to provide the functionality that our customers enjoy. Responsibilities Build high performance, scalable, well-structured and testable components for our platform and services. Research cutting edge technologies and techniques to improve application reliability, developer experience and raw performance. Work alongside engineering manager, product managers and business stakeholders to develop new features and maintain existing system Investigate and implement cutting edge technologies to improve site reliability, customer experience, and raw performance. Think outside the day-to-day and propose ways to elevate the art of e-commerce engineering. Automation first thinking, consistently evaluate and seek ways to improve own and team's productivity Technical stack : Golang & PHP for legacy services Requirements B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience. 3+ years of experience with high-traffic distributed systems and client-server architectures. Experience with Go in production grade services. Experience in other backend programming language especially PHP is a plus Solid computer science fundamentals (theory, data structures, algorithms, design patterns). Knowledge of networking and software infrastructure fundamentals. What we offer: A dynamic working environment Amazing office and great culture! Massage chairs, table tennis, video game room, quarterly team events, yearly company trip, end of the year party Hybrid working environment and work from home set up allowance Clear career progression plan and support English classes Macbook or laptop when you start Social insurance, medical insurance & health insurance 13th month salary Annual Bonus 15 days of annual leave, 30 days of sick leave/mental health. Support for Gym membership The ZALORA Story ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by ZALORA or Global Fashion Group. The ZALORA Story ZALORA is Asia’s leading online fashion, beauty and lifestyle destination, part of Global Fashion Group. As one of the region’s pioneer large-scale ecommerce platforms, ZALORA has established a strong presence throughout the region, particularly in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong, and in Taiwan, enjoying over 50 million visits per month. ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Title: Legal Counsel
Location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
Skills: English, Stakeholder management, Data Privacy / Compliance, Risk Management, Governance
Description: About the job About Rize Rize ( rize.farm ) is a leading Agri-Tech startup uniquely positioned to build solutions that make rice cultivation more sustainable and improve farmer livelihoods in Asia. These sustainable solutions are urgently needed as rice cultivation is one of the largest polluting forms of agriculture globally. Formed through a joint venture between Temasek, Wavemaker Impact, Breakthrough Energy Ventures, and GenZero, Rize’s technology captures vital agricultural data essential for implementing sustainable farming practices. This makes rice farmers more climate-resilient, increases their crop yields, lowers costs, and facilitates efficient access to finance. Rize currently has operations in Indonesia and Vietnam and plans to expand further within the region. To expand, Rize is unlocking climate/green financing facilities to help serve more farmers in their transition to sustainable rice cultivation. Rize has recently received substantial global media attention, acknowledging our efforts in this journey. Please read more here: Bloomberg , Business Insider , DealStreetAsia . What are we building We are developing a platform which will help our field operations team to effectively manage their task, capture cultivation logs from million plus hectares of paddy fields, effectively manage the supply chain of agri-inputs and aggregate third party services required during the lifecycle of paddy cultivation, harvest, and sale. Who We Look For We are looking for a sharp and commercial-minded Legal Counsel with strong credentials handling legal aspects of supply chain (with emphasis on distribution, trade, and commerce), employment, M&A, corporate governance, and license & permit application and management. Experience in agriculture, data privacy, and sustainability is a nice bonus. We expect the candidate to not only be well-versed in Vietnamese law and legal system, but can harness the law as a tool to facilitate business objectives. The candidate should always keep the commercial hat on and be able to translate business requirements into legal deliverables, whether contracts, permits, or otherwise. The ideal candidate must have a Vietnamese law degree with 3-5 years of experience, with a combination of at least 2 years spent in reputable law firms and 1 year as in-house counsel. The candidate must also be willing to work from office at least twice a week and travel to the fields on occassions. This position will report directly to the Head of Legal and work collaboratively with the operations, finance, HR, product & technology, and other teams in Vietnam. What We Can Offer You The candidate’s work will be impactful. From day one, he/she will be directly involved in developing Rize’s solutions. Legal insights the candidate contributes will impact how Rize structures and delivers its products and services. The candidate will play a key role towards our goals of improving the livelihoods of farmers we work with while at the same time incentivising them to adopt green, sustainable, carbon-friendly farming practices. Responsibilities Advising the business team on the delivery structure of Rize’s products and solutions Contract structuring, drafting, negotiation, and management, in particular with farming input suppliers, farmers, and farming cooperatives. Working with country HR team to determine optimum talent engagement structure Navigating Vietnam’s permit and licensing regime, including identification of permits Rize will need to acquire to conduct existing and future businesses. Translate business and financial requirements into legal deliverables, including the contracts that must be in place, the permits that need to be obtained, and the optimum way to engage necessary talents. Willing to work from the Office at least twice per week and travel to the fields. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in law from a Vietnamese university or otherwise admitted to practice in Vietnam. Minimum 3 years of experience as legal counsel, 2 of which must be spent in a reputable law firm and 1 year as in-house counsel. The candidate must demonstrate experience the two or more of the following areas: Supply chain (logistics, distribution, and retail); Merger & Acquisition and corporate governance; Employment; License & permit identification, application, and management. Experience in the following areas is highly desirable but not essential: Agriculture Data privacy; ESG, sustainability and carbon reduction. Must have skills: Strong proficiency in Word and basic proficiency in Excel . Able to work comfortably with Google Doc, Sheet, and other Google suites. Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Title: Test Development Engineer
Skills: Python, C++, C language, Project Management, Networking
Description: About the job Who You'll Work With To achieve these goals, the TDE must interface with design, process, test, and reliability engineering to solve problems. What You'll Do The Test Development Engineer provides new product and on-going test engineering support for a product or group of products with a strong demonstration of core engineering skills, design concepts / principles, diagnostic, and programming capabilities. In addition to the high level responsibilities listed below, candidate must also participate in defect reduction teams and process re-engineering teams, resolve product failure issues during manufacturing processes and plan, manage, and support production line moves. Engage with the new product operations teams from concept commit to product launch Test strategy planning, development, and review Test automation development Manage functional test capacity, expansion planning and execution Continuous yield improvement through process and test optimization Data driven test solution optimization and value engineering Drive innovative solutions to resolve business challenge and factory of the future Who You Are Typically requires a BSEE, BSEET, BSCE or equivalent experience plus 3~4 years Functional Test Development Experience. MSEE with 2+ years Test or Design experience preferred Software Programming / High level language proficiency (ex: C, C++, Python) Experience in software operating systems (Windows, Linux) and applications (ex: MS Office) Good written, verbal, and presentation skills PCBA and System manufacturing experience Ability to multitask with little direction/oversight from manager Desired Skills Project management skills a plus Understand network technology (CCNA a plus) Cisco product familiarity Understands system hardware architectures, design concepts, and engineering development practices Using various diagnostic tools, can debug and troubleshoot failing system down to board level, and boards down to component level. Test, debug, and bring-up proto boards Experience and understanding of various product development processes (hardware products - in-house design, OEM, ODM/JDM, and software) Why You'll Love Cisco WE ARE CISCO #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here's how we do it. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're "old" (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we're also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do - you can't put us in a box! But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take the difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

Title: Director, Visa Consulting & Analytics
Skills: Business Analysis, Data Analysis, Project Management, Stakeholder management, English
Description: About the job Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid. Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa. Job Description Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) is Visa's consulting division, serving Visa's clients (including card issuers, acquirers and merchants) and solving their strategic problems focused on improving performance and profitability. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, payments, data analytics, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, VCA drives high impact and tangible financial results. The incumbent will be part of VCA geographic team cluster of Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam, Myanmar and Cambodia (IPVMC) markets, and will report to the Head of VCA Vietnam. The team is involved in a comprehensive range of consulting services and solutions to our clients, that address unique challenges in areas such as strategic growth, profitability, risk management, digital strategy, and data-driven portfolio management decisions. If you like to use a fact-based, data-driven solutions to solve for business problems that deliver value and enable Vietnam clients to win more business, you should apply. What a Director does at Visa: As a VCA Director in Vietnam, you will be leading VCA engagements in the market. In this role, you are expected to: Use Visa and external data to analyze client needs and identify opportunities for consulting assignments with Visa’s key clients. Develop project pitches and secure new Consulting assignments with clients, as well as re-engagements opportunities via a consultative sales approach Deliver Consulting projects. Resolve complex strategic problems. Synthesize and manage complex project structures when required. Manage, facilitate, and implement consulting services and meet client's business targets (assignment objectives, project scope, budget, paperwork, external consultants' supervision and project delivery). Cultivate relationship with Visa’s clients and partners - Issuers, Acquirers, and Merchants & Fintech firms, by being strategically focused, optimize client performance and implement recommendations in customer life cycle management, new product development and launches Work cross-functionally with other Visa teams to bring a holistic solution to our clients leveraging Visa’s rich value-added services (VAS) from functions such as Marketing, Products, Risk and Merchant Solutions teams Develop propositions by closely working with Client Relationship Managers, promoting the solutions with external clients and, executing and delivering the consulting engagement to clients Enable growth and improve profitability across our clients’ payment business through portfolio management and segment expansion Deliver consulting revenue stream via the use of Visa Consulting and Analytics service lines and practice area Support the IPVMC VCA team in managing strategy, reporting and operations Why this is important to Visa As a payment consulting arm of Visa, VCA is growing a team of highly specialize experts that can provide best in class payment expertise to the client. We want to bring this expertise closer to our clients by having the Consulting Director in-market in Vietnam. We are a global organization leveraging global expertise and best practice with local knowledge and understanding of our client partners. This enables us to deepen our partnership with our clients and bring value to their business. Qualifications What you will need: We are looking to hire candidates that have already accumulated a variety of experience, you will be curious about the payments industry, results-driven and client-centric. As a candidate you should have: MBA or equivalent education, certifications and/or business background •12+ years of solid experience gained within the financial services practice of a top-tier consulting firm. •A combination of regional and global experience strongly desired. In-market experience and/or knowledge of local language and culture as well as regulation and industry trends •Understanding of card issuers’ P&L and cardholder life cycle •Knowledge of emerging trends in the local payment landscape including Fintech •Storyboarding and data storytelling including strong Excel and PowerPoint skills •Understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, modeling, scoring schemes, etc. •Strong organizational and business planning skills •Willingness to travel 30% within Vietnam What will also help: Deep experience in consulting, corporate strategy, or business management Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects with excellent project management skills Superior analytical and problem-solving skills, logical thinker with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor Strong internal team and external client stakeholder management with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style; able to work effectively in a matrixed organization Excellent presentation skills, including strong oral and written capabilities Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently Experience in and passion for the power of analytics to inform and drive strategy and tactics, and proven ability to generate insights from data, make actionable recommendations, and tenacity to implement Strong commercial acumen, with experience in working on business/value cases that prove ROI Solutions-focused mindset Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Workforce Planning and Productivity
Skills: Business Analysis, Project Management, Stakeholder management, Business Intelligence, English
Description: About the job ROLE SUMMARY The role of the Workforce Planning and Productivity is to work collaboratively with leadership stakeholders and their teams to uplift Workforce management services, drive performance uplift and to build operational leadership capability Lead the monthly workforce planning and forecasting activities across BUs, reconciliation, understand performance drivers, provide explanations plan variances/prior reporting periods and propose and support improvements. These goals will be enabled by building relationships and identifying opportunities to embed and elevate foundational skills and tools, which will in turn enable leaders to strive for high performing teams, with a growth mindset, that will benefit our colleagues and customers. The Workforce Planning and Productivity role is a trusted partners across EWPP, Enterprise Operations and broader T&EO teams and across NAB, thought leadership and execution of performance and operational excellence This role has no BEAR accountabilities and is not a responsible manager YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborating with the BU Workforce Planners and contribute to workforce planning activities including, but not limited to, forward view for financial year planning Identifying and action opportunities and deliver actionable insights for operational improvement Guiding & Supporting Executive, Heads of and operational leaders on workforce planning activities Educating stakeholders about analytics and operational best practice. Develop and maintain workforce management models, insight reporting (WFM) and support business strategic deliverables. Escalation of risks, issues and blockers Proactively managing risk; meeting all policy and compliance requirements; performing controls; adhering to process and procedures; and escalating events, issues or breaches as they are identified. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Experience Minimum of 7 years in a Workforce, Operational or Project Leadership role ideally within Financial Services and/or Banking sectors Experience in Workforce Tools & Methodology Business Improvement & Business Process re-engineering Essential capabilities Business Analysis & Problem Solving Ability to blend and connect the right resources and ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities Strong communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to influence stakeholders from leads to executives. Knowledge of Workforce Management Technology and/or Operations Other capabilities: Office 365 suite of product, chief amongst them Excel and PowerPoint THE BENEFITS AND PERKS We appreciate and reward our colleagues who do great work every day – from excelling for our customers, to taking ownership of an issue to get it resolved. Here’s how we support our people with a range of exclusive benefits. 1. Generous compensation and benefit package Attractive salary 20-day paid annual leave and 7-day paid sick leave 13th month salary and Annual Performance Bonus Premium healthcare for yourself and family members Monthly allowance for team activities Premium welcome kit and occasional gifts of appreciation Extra benefits on your work anniversary 2. Exciting career and development opportunities Large scale products with modern technologies in banking domain Clear roadmap for career advancement in both technical and leadership pathways Access to digital learning platform such as Udemy Consistent and high-quality leadership training through the Distinctive Leadership program (DLP) Specialist capabilities and accreditations in key skill areas such as Cloud Engineering, Digital, Data, Security and SREs (Site reliability engineers) Sponsored English course with native teachers Opportunity for training in Australia 3. Professional and engaging working environment Hybrid working model and excellent work-life balance State-of-the-art & modern Agile office Food and beverages in the office pantry Employee Assistance Program to improve your physical and mental health Annual team activities and company events A solid and talented team behind you – great people who love what they do A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE WORKS BETTER FOR EVERYONE We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their true authentic selves at NAB. With our focus on inclusion and diversity, and in partnership with our Employee Resource Groups, NAB is a place where First Nations colleagues, colleagues of all genders, sexualities and ages, carers and colleagues with disability, and colleagues from all cultures, races and religions have the opportunity to thrive, connect and grow. We are intent on providing an environment where you can work your way. Ask about our many flexible work options and please let us know if we can provide any adjustments throughout the recruitment process. CLOUD-FIRST NAB is undergoing an exciting "Cloud First" technology transformation by taking advantage of the latest tools and techniques used by leading technology and digital companies globally. But it’s not just about the Tech, we are also investing heavily in our people, so if you have an appetite to learn, grow and elevate others around you, this is the place for you! If this excites you, let's have a chat over a cup of coffee!

Title: Graduate QA / Junior QA (Willing to work on Salesforce/NetSuite/SAP/Backoffice)
Skills: Automation Test, Regression testing, Integration test, Functional specifications, Jira
Description: About the job Role Overview: We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Applications QA Engineer to join our quality assurance team. In this role, you will assist in testing software applications to ensure functionality, reliability, and performance meet business and user requirements. You will work closely with developers, product managers, and senior QA engineers to execute test cases, report bugs, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our QA processes. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in software quality assurance within a collaborative, fast-paced environment. Key Responsibilities Log and follow up defects into the bug tracking system with the required fields based on testing standards so that results can be reproduced and debugged Understand and address peer review comments Participate in the debugging/triage process Build and maintain effective relationships Provide clear estimates and updates on progress against assigned tasks during scrum ceremonies Escalate any problems and exceptions that need to be addressed to the QA Lead in a timely manner Continue to develop skills via self-study, classes and shadowing Demonstrate behaviors according to IT Principles & Values Develop manual functional / regression tests and documentation against specified timescales, quality and acceptance criteria to ensure definition of done is met Conduct Functional, Integration and Regression testing, tracking defects as required Review own test cases and identify opportunities to improve Implements Test Automation using appropriate testing tools according to application/framework to be tested and agreed coding standards Maintain, update and fix existing automation suites according to requirement and development changes Develop an understanding of source control technologies and follow established branching standards Skills & Experience Acts with a clear sense of ownership Attentively Listens to Others Delivers messages in a clear and concise manner Partners with others to get work done Gains the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity and sincerity Learns from new experiences, from others, and from structured learning Asks the right questions to accurately analyze situation Sets objectives to align with broader organizational goals ISTQB Foundation qualification

Title: Information Security Specialist
Salary: Competitive salary based on market rates, job responsibilities, and individual capabilities
Skills: Information Security, Risk Management, Cybersecurity, Firewall, SIEM
Description: About the job We are looking for the Information Security Specialist to join our Information Technology Division at Viettel Group. JOB DESCRIPTION: Development of Group-wide Information Security Policies: Develop strategies, regulations, standards, and guidelines for information security (InfoSec) in alignment with domestic laws and international best practices. Ensure policies are realistic and tailored to the organization’s current state and capabilities. Information Security Program Management and Implementation: Oversee InfoSec compliance at member units; evaluate the quality of InfoSec products and services; organize training sessions, simulations, and awareness programs for enhanced InfoSec practices. Information Security Risk Management: Identify and assess InfoSec risks, develop mitigation plans; identify critical information assets and implement risk control and monitoring measures. Development of InfoSec Human Resources: Guide the development of InfoSec organizational models and personnel criteria for member units. Implement training programs to enhance InfoSec skills, expertise, and culture throughout the organization. Incident Monitoring and Violation Handling: Monitor and analyze security incidents, identify root causes, and propose systemic remediation measures. Information Security Solution Design & Planning: Develop and deploy centralized InfoSec solutions. Evaluate solution designs, investment proposals, and assess the quality of InfoSec products and services. REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree or higher (formal full-time program) with at least a “Good” classification, majoring in Information Security, Information Technology, or a related field. Knowledge of Vietnamese legal regulations and international InfoSec standards (e.g., ISO 27000, NIST). Foundational knowledge and experience in InfoSec, including cyberattack methods and security vulnerabilities. Familiarity and hands-on experience with InfoSec devices and applications (e.g., Firewalls, IPS/IDS, SIEM). Preferred: Candidates with experience in InfoSec legal frameworks, cybersecurity, or personal data protection. Preferred: Candidates with international InfoSec certifications (e.g., CISM, CISSP, CRISC). TOEIC score of 650+ or equivalent English proficiency. Minimum of 2 years of experience, with at least 1 year in InfoSec governance or compliance control. BENEFITS Competitive salary based on market rates, job responsibilities, and individual capabilities Cash gifts during holidays, Tet, and the company’s founding anniversary, along with annual vacation support. Health insurance coverage, annual health check-ups at reputable medical facilities, and the opportunity to purchase health insurance for family members at discounted rates. Opportunities for training and working with experts domestically and internationally. OTHER INFORMATION Workplace: Ton That Thuyet St, Cau Giay Dist, Hanoi. Office hours: 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM, 1:30 PM - 5:30 PM from Monday to Friday. Email: tuyendung@viettel.com.vn

Collaborate with frontend developers, DevOps, QA, and product teams to deliver seamless end-to-end features. Integrate third-party services, databases, and internal systems with RESTful and GraphQL APIs. Ensure application responsiveness, performance, and uptime in production environments. Write unit and integration tests to maintain high code quality and support continuous integration. Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior developers when needed. Maintain documentation for APIs, services, and infrastructure as part of the development process. Stay current with evolving backend technologies, frameworks, and industry trends. Required Qualifications:Experience & Technical Skills 3+ years of experience in backend development using Go Hands-on experience working with WebRTC, RESTful APIs, and WebSocket implementations. Experience with relational and non-relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB). Solid understanding of authentication and authorization mechanisms (JWT, OAuth2, etc.). Proficient in using Git and collaborative development workflows. Knowledge of software testing (unit, integration) and testing tools (e.g., Jest, Supertest). Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Good command of English, both verbal and written, is a must. Nice to Have Experience with containerization and deployment tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices. Knowledge of microservices architecture and event-driven systems (e.g., using RabbitMQ, Kafka). Prior experience working in agile/scrum environments. Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure. Experience with Live streaming is plus Soft Skills & Collaboration Ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment. Excellent communication skills and team collaboration mindset.

Title: Senior Analyst, Desktop services Support (MacOS)
Skills: Windows, MacOS, Active Directory, PowerShell, ITIL Foundation
Description: About the job About the job: Responsible for 2nd level technical support for the Workplace Technology used by National Australia Bank colleagues. Provision of 2nd level technical support to investigation and resolve macOS and Windows system issues – including platform, environment, base application and user setup issues. Main Responsibilities: Provides 2nd-level technical support of all facets of the Workplace Technology offerings Represents the service(s) across the organization Accountable for the successful resolution of Medium and Low incident management records for users Understands the end-to-end (E2E) technical service(s) including dependent components and infrastructure Accountable for the successful resolution of high, medium and low problems management records Contributes to technical incident bridges with internal staff and 3rd party suppliers. Collaborates with Workplace Technology SME’s to ensure that projects handed to Workplace are delivered in accordance with stated strategic and tactical objectives. Identifies opportunities to drive efficiency through Automation Contribute to the tracking and reporting against agreed service KPIs, SLA’s, Service Health and the contractual obligations of 3rd party Service Providers. Drive continuous technical improvement to the service ensuring Security and Architectural standards are adhered to. Maintains a high level of knowledge relating to the nominated service including roadmaps, pre-release features and the 2nd level impacts when considering implementation in the NAB environment. Maintains knowledge and understanding of the wider Workplace Technology portfolio and identifies opportunities to leverage complementary technologies to drive efficiency through effective consumption of existing toolsets. Contributes to the technical governance of service management processes including, incident, problem, change, configuration, capacity, continuity (DR), availability, asset, monitoring and alerting Asset lifecycle planning to ensure that the asset fits with the Groups standards and strategic direction Collaborate with 3rd party service providers, project services and service management to ensure high quality and successful transition of all service(s) changes Ensure adequate communication, knowledge sharing and issue resolution across delivery and support teams Stakeholder Management & management of stakeholder expectations Ensure appropriate data quality controls are in place across the portfolio Fulfil other tasks as assigned by your People Leader and/or authorized representative of NAB Vietnam from time to time. KEY CHALLENGES: Providing technical support for a business-critical function ensuring service stability, resolution of incidents within SLA and driving efficiency within the service. Driving operational & technology change agenda to mature services in line with industry direction Ensuring service change and service transition is executed flawlessly MANDATORY TECHNICAL SKILLS 3-5 years’ experience delivering technical support and development services to large scale enterprise deployments of macOS and Windows end-user platforms 3-5 year’s managing and administering large scale JAMF and Active Directory (physical and virtual) end-user environments for macOS and Windows. Experience implementing and managing Base Operating Environments (BOE) and SOE 5 years’ experience delivering Workplace services in an enterprise environment. Experience in JAMF and/or AD support and implementation Experience (2 years) experience in creation of scripts (PowerShell or other similar tech) to drive Automation opportunities Experience (2+ years) experience delivering service in an enterprise ITIL environment In-depth understanding of the security challenges in complex EUC environments Strong awareness and understanding of hardware, networks, software technologies and applications Relevant industry certifications desirable. Strong business communication and interpersonal skills Proven ability to remain flexible to deliver business outcomes Tertiary qualification in a Technology discipline or related field Proven experience in coordinating multiple stakeholders and 3rd parties to deliver successful outcomes in a time sensitive environment Knowledge and understanding of industry trends and technology THE BENEFITS AND PERKS We appreciate and reward our colleagues who do great work every day – from excelling for our customers, to taking ownership of an issue to get it resolved. Here’s how we support our people with a range of exclusive benefits. 1. Generous compensation and benefit package Attractive salary 20-day paid annual leave and 7-day paid sick leave 13th month salary and Annual Performance Bonus Premium healthcare for yourself and family members Monthly allowance for team activities Premium welcome kit and occasional gifts of appreciation Extra benefits on your work anniversary 2. Exciting career and development opportunities Large scale products with modern technologies in banking domain Clear roadmap for career advancement in both technical and leadership pathways Access to digital learning platform such as Udemy Consistent and high-quality leadership training through the Distinctive Leadership program (DLP) Specialist capabilities and accreditations in key skill areas such as Cloud Engineering, Digital, Data, Security and SREs (Site reliability engineers) Sponsored English course with native teachers Opportunity for training in Australia 3. Professional and engaging working environment Hybrid working model and excellent work-life balance State-of-the-art & modern Agile office Food and beverages in the office pantry Employee Assistance Program to improve your physical and mental health Annual team activities and company events A solid and talented team behind you – great people who love what they do A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE WORKS BETTER FOR EVERYONE We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their true authentic selves at NAB. With our focus on inclusion and diversity, and in partnership with our Employee Resource Groups, NAB is a place where First Nations colleagues, colleagues of all genders, sexualities and ages, carers and colleagues with disability, and colleagues from all cultures, races and religions have the opportunity to thrive, connect and grow. We are intent on providing an environment where you can work your way. Ask about our many flexible work options and please let us know if we can provide any adjustments throughout the recruitment process. CLOUD-FIRST NAB is undergoing an exciting "Cloud First" technology transformation by taking advantage of the latest tools and techniques used by leading technology and digital companies globally. But it’s not just about the Tech, we are also investing heavily in our people, so if you have an appetite to learn, grow and elevate others around you, this is the place for you! If this excites you, let's have a chat over a cup of coffee! It's more than just a career at NAB! We believe in people with people and dreams, and we want you to achieve your aspirations. More than just a career, NAB Vietnam offers you a flexibility to balance your work - life, the opportunity to grow as professionals, people and a complete set of well-being offerings. If you have an appetite to learn, grow and elevate others around you, this is the place for you. IT'S MORE THAN MONEY We naturally also provide a very competitive remuneration package but a career with us is about a lot more than money. We believe in people with ideas and dreams, and we want you to achieve your aspirations. We will work together to deliver exceptional products and outcomes that push the limits of our own aspirations. Our passion for creating value and exceeding our customers' expectations means we are constantly striving to redefine our standards of excellence. You will have our backing to develop and our encouragement to explore, realize and reach your full potential.

Title: QA Engineer
Location: Quận 3, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Skills: Software testing, QA QC, Agile, Jira, English
Description: About the job Introduction Here at Skedulo we’re on a mission to support the 2.7 billion people in the world—and the companies that employ them—who do not work at a desk every day. Our global teams are collaborative, ambitious, innovative, and passionate about helping our customers realize their fullest potential by enabling their mobile workforces. The Skedulo team is a tight-knit group of builders who are passionate about shaping our platform that is relied upon daily by thousands of users across the globe . We are looking for motivated, self-starters who share our values , challenge the status quo, and push the pace of innovation in order to accelerate growth. If you’re drawn to solving hard problems and want to help design software that will make a difference in people’s lives, Skedulo is for you. Visit our website to learn more about what Skedulo does and to learn more about our people and team. Description We're seeking an innovative and experienced Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer to join our team. You'll play a crucial role in delivering high-quality customization projects and ensuring product excellence through robust software quality assurance processes. In this role, you'll develop and execute the test plans, scripts, test cases, and test reports. You'll collaborate closely with developers and other QA teams to identify and resolve production issues, ensuring all quality standards are met and our products are fully functional, exceeding expectations. This position demands strong communication and analytical skills, along with a thorough understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). With a keen eye on customer satisfaction and user experience, you'll enhance product quality through comprehensive functional, performance, smoke, regression, and end-to-end testing, implementing automation where beneficial. Responsibilities Develop test plans: Design and implement detailed test plans to evaluate software functionality, performance, and usability. Create test cases: Analyze requirements, specifications, and user stories to develop comprehensive test cases covering various scenarios, ensuring products meet user expectations. You'll also leverage AI for test case generation. Execute manual testing: Perform thorough manual testing to identify defects and ensure expected software operation. Conduct audits and quality control: Regularly review and audit quality standards to maintain high-quality software and identify any product issues. Collaborate with the development team: Work closely with developers and QA team members to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues during the software development process. Document test results: Record and analyze test results to provide insights into software performance and reliability. Perform smoke or regression testing: Conduct smoke and regression testing to ensure that software updates do not impact existing functionality. Enhance user experience: Contribute to customer satisfaction and user experience goals through dedicated quality assurance efforts. Present Findings: Demonstrate features, bugs, or sprint progress to the Project team. Minimum Qualifications Education: A bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field. Experience: Previous experience in software testing, quality assurance, or a QA role in the tech industry, and three years of experience in Web Application Testing. Testing Expertise: Solid understanding of software testing methodologies, tools, and processes. Communication & Presentation: Good written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present and demo sprints, features, or bug fixes to project teams. Collaboration: A strong teamwork ethic is essential. Growth Mindset: Enjoys problem-solving while continuously learning, developing, and applying new skills. Desired Skills & Experience Documentation Expertise: Experienced in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans, test cases, and bug reports. Mobile Testing: Proven experience in mobile application testing. Agile Proficiency: Experienced in working within an Agile methodology environment. Tooling (Beneficial): Working knowledge of the Atlassian Suite (Jira, Confluence, Service Desk) is a plus. Team Collaboration (Beneficial): Prior experience working with offshore and distributed teams is beneficial. Platform Specific: Experience with testing on the Salesforce platform or CRM is beneficial. Additional Qualifications Must be authorized to work in the country where this position is based without the need for visa sponsorship at time of application. Must have reliable internet connection and an at home workstation setup. (For remote positions) Benefits Global Offerings Competitive Salary Package including 13th month bonus New Hire Stock Options Employee Referral Bonus Program 3 volunteer days per year A generous budget to spend on setting up your home office or WFH station 100% employer paid access to Udemy (Learning & Development) Paid Parental Leave for both carers (12 weeks) Vietnam Specific Offerings Hybrid Work Model (3 days in the office & 2 days work from home) Private Medical Benefits (PTI Health Insurance) for employee + family 100% employer paid annual health check 7 paid sick leave days per year 20 paid personal leave days per year 12 paid public holiday days per year Company & Team Offsite Events provided Our office offers open and creative workspaces with room to play, reflect, and relax Our team works hard but also plays hard; we will challenge your best table tennis and PS4 skills Kitchen stocked with snacks & drinks

Title: Mobile Developer (Relocate to Dubai)
Location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
Skills: Android, iOS, API, Git, Agile
Description: About the job **Please note that the job is onsite in Dubai, relocation is a must (company sponsor)** Job Description: Develop, test, and maintain mobile applications for Android or iOS platforms. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications. Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs. Work closely with UI/UX designers to integrate high-quality front-end designs. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency. Write clean, scalable, and efficient code following best practices. Contribute to the overall development strategy by staying up-to-date with the latest mobile technology trends and advancements. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience (4+ years) in developing mobile applications using Android Native (Java/Kotlin) or iOS Native (Swift/Objective-C). Strong understanding of mobile application architecture and frameworks. Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect mobile applications to back-end services. Experience with version control systems, such as Git. Solid understanding of the full mobile development lifecycle. Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Good communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in integrating third-party libraries and APIs. Familiarity with cloud messaging APIs and push notifications. Experience with mobile analytics and A/B testing tools. Knowledge of automated testing and continuous integration. What We Will Offer: Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a salary package tailored to your skills and experience, along with performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive Benefits: We support your well-being with accommodation, meal allowances, and assistance with work visa processing. Work-Life Balance: Unwind with generous holiday and New Year bonuses. Top-Tier Equipment: Stay productive with the latest tools, including a MacBook and iPhone. Thriving Culture: Immerse yourself in a dynamic, inclusive work environment that fosters growth. Employee Support: Enjoy twice-yearly expense reimbursements for home visits.

Regularly follow up on sellers' operational status, provide market updates and industry trends, assisting sellers in optimizing their product lines and marketing strategies. At least 3 year of relevant work experience, with familiarity with the operation mode and rules of e-commerce platform. Excellent communication and negotiation skills, capable of establishing and maintaining good relationships with sellers. Strong learning ability and problem-solving skills, able to adapt quickly to market changes. Team player, able to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and proactively contribute to achieving business objectives.

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE Good salary and a bonus if things work well Working & growing with an international team Onsite opportunities: short-term and long-term assignments in Europe 18 days off allowance per year Premium insurance for you and your family member (spouse/ parent/ children) & yearly check-up Loyalty program after three years and five years Flexible working time (40h/week) with Hybrid working policy: open for good reasons and subject to prior requesting. Highly professional equipment (Mac/Thinkpad, 2 screens, adjustable desks) Intense English course for the first 3 months by our native English teachers and Optional English seminars during the work time Training sponsored by mgm An amazing company trip once a year, team-building with the project team and month-end with the whole company, covered by mgm Free in-house entertainment facilities (darts, piano, climbing wall), drinks (coffee, beer, soft drinks,…) and food (cookies, fruit,…) and out-house company-funded sport clubs (football, swimming, badminton...) APPLY NOW!

Title: Translator

We are looking for a bilingual professional to join our team and teach AI chatbots. You will have conversations in both Vietnamese and English with chatbots in order to measure their progress, as well as write novel conversations in order to teach them what to say. Benefits: This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on You can work on your own schedule Projects are paid hourly, starting at $20+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work Responsibilities (both in Vietnamese and English): Come up with diverse conversations over a range of topics Write high-quality answers when given specific prompts Compare the performance of different AI models Research and fact-check AI responses Qualifications: Fluent in Vietnamese + English A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress) Excellent writing and grammar skills Strong research and fact-checking skills to ensure accuracy and originality Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. #vietnamese

Title: Kỹ sư phát triển nhà cung cấp, Bao bì (tiếng Quan Thoại, tiếng Anh)
Skills: English, Chinese, Project Management, QA QC, Stakeholder management
Description: About the job Please visit this Google Careers posting for the English-translated version of this role. Minimum qualifications: Bằng cử nhân chuyên ngành Kỹ thuật bao bì, Kỹ thuật vật liệu hoặc quy trình, ngành có liên quan hoặc có kinh nghiệm thực tế tương đương. 8 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực Sản xuất, Chất lượng hoặc Bao bì. Khả năng giao tiếp thông thạo bằng cả tiếng Quan Thoại và tiếng Anh để làm việc với các bên liên quan. Preferred qualifications: Nắm rõ quy trình sản xuất và thiết kế bao bì in ấn cho ngành bán lẻ. Hiểu biết về quản lý chất lượng quy trình sản xuất bao bì cho thiết bị điện tử ngành bán lẻ. Khả năng phối hợp liên chức năng và liên khu vực với nhiều nhóm. Kỹ năng xuất sắc về khắc phục sự cố, kiểm soát quy trình bằng thống kê, phân tích lỗi và quản lý chương trình. About The Job Khi đảm nhận vai trò Kỹ sư phát triển nhà cung cấp, bạn sẽ phụ trách việc quản lý chương trình kỹ thuật, Kỹ thuật quy trình và Kỹ thuật chất lượng. Công việc chính của bạn liên quan đến quy trình sản xuất, phân phối các thành phần bao bì được thiết kế để bảo vệ thiết bị và nâng cao trải nghiệm người dùng về bao bì. Bạn sẽ đảm nhận cả giai đoạn Ra mắt sản phẩm mới (NPI) và quá trình sản xuất hàng loạt bền vững sau đó. Phạm vi công việc bao gồm các khâu từ tiếp nhận nguyên liệu thô, in ấn, định hình cấu trúc, lắp ráp đến giao hàng từ nhà cung cấp bao bì đến nhà máy thiết bị để đóng gói. Trong vai trò này, bạn sẽ tinh chỉnh việc Quản lý hệ thống chất lượng của nhà cung cấp để đáp ứng tiêu chuẩn của Google, đồng thời chủ động phối hợp với nhóm thiết kế, người quản lý nguồn cung và nhà cung cấp từ đầu giai đoạn NPI (ví dụ: lựa chọn nhà cung cấp, DFM). Sứ mệnh của Google là hệ thống hoá thông tin của thế giới và làm cho thông tin đó trở nên hữu ích và dễ tiếp cận trên toàn cầu. Nhóm Thiết bị và dịch vụ của chúng tôi kết hợp những điểm ưu việt nhất có trong AI của Google, Phần mềm và Phần cứng nhằm mang lại trải nghiệm toàn diện, hữu ích cho người dùng. Chúng tôi nghiên cứu, thiết kế và phát triển các công nghệ cũng như phần cứng mới để người dùng có thể tương tác với máy tính một cách nhanh chóng, mạnh mẽ và liền mạch hơn. Từ việc tìm kiếm những phương thức mới để nắm bắt và cảm nhận thế giới xung quanh, cải tiến các yếu tố hình thức, cho đến cải thiện phương pháp tương tác, nhóm Thiết bị và dịch vụ của chúng tôi luôn hướng đến mục tiêu làm cho cuộc sống của mọi người trở nên tốt đẹp hơn thông qua công nghệ. Responsibilities Xây dựng và triển khai các chiến lược quản lý nhà cung cấp cho bộ phận Bao bì phần cứng của Google, cộng tác với Người quản lý cung ứng toàn cầu (GSM) và Kỹ sư sản phẩm (PE). Tìm kiếm và đánh giá chất lượng các nhà cung cấp bao bì, đảm bảo tuân thủ các tiêu chuẩn chất lượng và thời hạn giao sản phẩm của Google. Giám sát quá trình phát triển sản phẩm mới tại nhà máy của nhà cung cấp, tập trung vào tỷ lệ thành phẩm cao và hoạt động đóng gói hiệu quả. Đảm bảo rằng nhà cung cấp bao bì sẵn sàng sản xuất bao bì cho các sản phẩm mới và quản lý chất lượng tổng thể. Cộng tác với các phòng ban liên ngành, bao gồm Nhà thiết kế công nghiệp và Kỹ sư thiết kế, để đảm bảo chất lượng bao bì và khả năng sản xuất. Hỗ trợ kỹ thuật và đào tạo cho các nhà cung cấp, đảm bảo tuân thủ các thông số kỹ thuật và tiêu chuẩn chất lượng của Google. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Senior NPI Manufacturing Engineer
Skills: Project Management, English, Vietnamese, Leadership, Communication Skills
Description: About the job Nvidia is seeking a dedicated and experienced individual as a NPI Manufacturing based in Vietnam. In this pivotal role, Your primary responsibilities will include executing NPI manufacturing operations strategies to drive operational excellence and continuous improvement across our NPI in Vietnam. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and supply base partners to ensure the fulfillment of build plans, optimize processes, enhance productivity, and uphold the highest standards of quality and efficiency. What You'll Be Doing Develop and implement NPI site missions, Lead day-to-day operations, coordinating staff, resources, and processes to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. Monitor and assess operational performance in Vietnam, identifying areas for enhancement and implementing necessary changes. Achieve build plans to guarantee supply fulfillment. Addressing technical and business issues promptly and effectively. Ensure compliance with regional laws, regulations, and company policies in Vietnam. Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with CM factory. Represent Nvidia NPI operations in Vietnam and work in high collaboration with the region management. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment on working models, resources, processes, tools, and KPIs. Uphold Nvidia's core values and codes, foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. Support the governance and implementation of digital transformation initiatives, ensuring adherence to best practices and infrastructure setup. Provide regular reports and updates on NPI operational performance in Vietnam to senior management. What We Need To See Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Engineering, 5+ years of experience Business or equivalent. Excellent knowledge of boards, systems, and network product manufacturing flow and processes with proven program management capability and experiences in an outsourcing environment. Excellent technical leadership skills such as project planning, scheduling and resource management skills. Consistent track record of collaboration across teams, customers, and local partners. Outstanding analytical and problem-solving capabilities Experience working in a global manufacturing environment Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Fluency in Vietnamese and English If you are an ambitious, passionate leader who thrives on challenges and is eager to embark on a groundbreaking journey with Nvidia in Vietnam—a rapidly evolving manufacturing hub for the artificial intelligence industry—we invite you to join us. JR1995166

What you will need: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Business, HR or Economics; At least 6 years of experiences in HR Management/ HRBP/ HR General; Strong engagement, ability to build relationship, trust, influence others and advanced communication skills; Strong problem solving, analytical skills.

Title: Enterprise Architect - Business Everyday Banking
Skills: Solution Architecture, Cloud, Security, Microservices Architecture, English
Description: About the job About the Job: We're currently hiring for Solution Architect position in Vietnam, a pivotal position that will play key role in designing scalable, secure, and modern enterprise solutions aligned with NAB's global technology strategy. This is not just a technical role - it's a strategic opportunity to influence how we deliver products service at scale, support business growth, enable engineering excellence. Main Responsibilities: Engage proactively with Product Owners, Project Managers, and Engineering team to define and deliver end-to-end solution architectures that align with NAB’s enterprise technology roadmap and strategic priorities. Lead architectural option analysis, providing well-informed recommendations that balance speed to value, cost-effectiveness, security, and long-term alignment with NAB’s target state. This includes deep evaluation of COTS solutions, optimal microservice architectures, and appropriate use of public cloud services. Collaborate closely with the broader architecture community—including Enterprise, Security, and Data Architects—to ensure solutions are fully integrated, secure by design, and aligned with enterprise-wide patterns, standards, and governance. Fulfil other tasks as assigned by your People Leader and/or authorized representative of NAB Vietnam from time to time. You will bring the following skills and experience: 10+ years in Technology generally and 5+ years in Solution / Enterprise architecture. Excellent verbal and written English language skills. Strong negotiation and influencing skills to help shape business and tech strategy. Understand the trade-off involved in technology change while simultaneously delivering business benefits. Ie Choosing to use an off- target state platform to as a tactical solution in order to meet regulatory requirements whilst the target state platform is being built. Experience driving end-to-end solutions in complex organisations with regulatory and legacy constraints. Highly desirable: Preferable: Commercial / Business Lending experience highly desirable. Experience in specialised finance, in particular Leasing / Equipment Finance is beneficial, as is any experience in programs of legacy transformation Architecture or technology-related certifications/cloud will be an advantage THE BENEFITS AND PERKS We appreciate and reward our colleagues who do great work every day – from excelling for our customers, to taking ownership of an issue to get it resolved. Here’s how we support our people with a range of exclusive benefits. 1. Generous compensation and benefit package Attractive salary 20-day paid annual leave and 7-day paid sick leave 13th month salary and Annual Performance Bonus Premium healthcare for yourself and family members Monthly allowance for team activities Premium welcome kit and occasional gifts of appreciation Extra benefits on your work anniversary 2. Exciting career and development opportunities Large scale products with modern technologies in banking domain Clear roadmap for career advancement in both technical and leadership pathways Access to digital learning platform such as Udemy Consistent and high-quality leadership training through the Distinctive Leadership program (DLP) Specialist capabilities and accreditations in key skill areas such as Cloud Engineering, Digital, Data, Security and SREs (Site reliability engineers) Sponsored English course with native teachers Opportunity for training in Australia 3. Professional and engaging working environment Hybrid working model and excellent work-life balance State-of-the-art & modern Agile office Food and beverages in the office pantry Employee Assistance Program to improve your physical and mental health Annual team activities and company events A solid and talented team behind you – great people who love what they do A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE WORKS BETTER FOR EVERYONE We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their true authentic selves at NAB. With our focus on inclusion and diversity, and in partnership with our Employee Resource Groups, NAB is a place where First Nations colleagues, colleagues of all genders, sexualities and ages, carers and colleagues with disability, and colleagues from all cultures, races and religions have the opportunity to thrive, connect and grow. We are intent on providing an environment where you can work your way. Ask about our many flexible work options and please let us know if we can provide any adjustments throughout the recruitment process. CLOUD-FIRST NAB is undergoing an exciting "Cloud First" technology transformation by taking advantage of the latest tools and techniques used by leading technology and digital companies globally. But it’s not just about the Tech, we are also investing heavily in our people, so if you have an appetite to learn, grow and elevate others around you, this is the place for you! If this excites you, let's have a chat over a cup of coffee!

We specialize in Strategy & Governance, Product Design & Growth, Software Engineering, Data Analytics & AI, Cloud & Enterprise Platforms, Cybersecurity, and industry-specific solutions for Banking, Life Sciences, and Smart Industrial sectors. Provide input into the target state architecture for the platform. With their peers, develop a robust, automated, and modern CICD practice within the team. Developing high-quality solutions collaboratively with the team and appropriate members throughout the engineering function using a mix of front-end (web and mobile) and back-end technologies. Working incrementally towards delivery of the platform. Collaborating closely with Product using customer data and insights to drive the solutions. Establishing strong quality and automation practices and processes. Lead technical projects, including architecture and design decisions, code reviews/pairing, and mentoring of junior team members. Working closely with our Platform teams to implement software leveraging our internal platforms, tools, frameworks, and infrastructure where appropriate. Collaborating closely with product owners, delivery leads, and business analysts to break down, estimate, and deliver business requirements. Contributing to the improvement of software development lifecycle processes. Participate in and, at times, facilitate Engineering Dojos driving a culture of Engineering Excellence. Provide continuous support and guidance to less senior colleagues through regular coaching activities and support them in fulfilling their personal development plans Qualifications 5+ years of software engineering experience Expertise in TypeScript /JavaScript, React, and front-end development; proficiency in full-stack development with at least one server-side language (NodeJS preferred). Hands-on experience with AWS. Experienced in Continuous Delivery practices (CI, TBD, etc.) Hands-on experience of testing methodologies (e.g., TDD, BDD, mocking) or a willingness to develop further in this area Experience using automation tools to build robust, automated build/release/deploy processes (e.g. GitHub Actions) Must-have experience using Terraform to build Infrastructure as code Experience leveraging modern software design patterns (e.g., SOLID, Strategy/Observer/Facade, hexagonal architecture) and both object-oriented and functional programming. Experience using, building, and running containers locally and exposure to concepts pertaining to container orchestration in a production environment (e.g. ECS, EKS/Kubernetes, docker-compose) Commitment to continuous learning and staying up to date with software engineering trends. Experience in designing team and service interfaces, leveraging contracts and specifications (OpenAPI / Swagger) to driver discussions and designs. Proven ability to work successfully in and with a remote, global team. Good at English communication

Title: DLT Engineering Lead
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
