Description: About the job Job description: Role Summary: As the DLT Engineering Lead , you will guide the design, development, and evolution of the core blockchain protocol. You will lead a team of protocol engineers, drive architectural decisions, and collaborate closely with stakeholders to align the protocol’s direction with business goals. Your leadership will be pivotal in scaling our infrastructure for enterprise-grade applications and ensuring compliance with the highest security standards. Key Responsibilities: Lead the technical design and evolution of blockchain protocol, ensuring scalability, performance, and privacy. Manage and mentor a team of protocol engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence. Conduct deep analysis of blockchain/DLT networks and contribute strategic insights to improve protocol stack. Spearhead development of privacy-preserving features using zero-knowledge proofs, state channels, and advanced cryptographic techniques. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Security, Compliance) to ensure alignment on protocol requirements. Oversee code reviews, security audits, and performance benchmarking. Contribute to open-source projects and represent technical forums and consortia. Maintain documentation and ensure best practices in version control, testing, and CI/CD pipelines. Required Skills: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 7+ years of experience in software development, with at least 2 years in a technical leadership role. Strong background in blockchain/DLT technologies such as Hyperledger Besu, GETH, Fabric, or Canton. Solid understanding of core blockchain components including consensus, P2P, networking, and state management. Expertise in cryptography, including digital signatures, encryption, and key management. Knowledge of Merkle Trees, zero-knowledge proofs, and group signatures. Proficient in back-end development with Go, Rust, or Java. Experience in architecting distributed systems at scale. Preferred Qualifications: Hands-on experience developing and deploying EVM smart contracts. Knowledge of consensus algorithms (Raft, Paxos, QBFT) and P2P protocols (gossiping, DHTs, NAT traversal). Experience leading Agile teams and managing project delivery. Familiarity with Node.js, Typescript, and JavaScript. Prior contributions to blockchain-related open-source projects in the Ethereum ecosystem. What Can We Offer You? Competitive salary 13th-month salary guarantee Performance bonus Professional English courses for employees Premium health insurance Note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive, we are unable to respond to every candidate individually. If you have not received a response from GFT regarding your application within 10 workdays, please consider that we have decided to proceed with other candidates. We truly appreciate your interest in GFT and thank you for your understanding.

Title: Data Engineer
Skills: Data Engineering, ETL, SQL, Python, Database
Description: About the job We are a fast-growing SaaS company in the EduTech space, operating mainly in Singapore, Vietnam, and Malaysia. With almost 2000 schools as customers, our mission is to revolutionize early childhood education through technology and provide innovative solutions to our customers. We are committed to transforming the way education is delivered in the Southeast Asian region and beyond. About the Role: We are looking for an experienced Data Migration Engineer to lead and execute complex, large-scale data migration from a legacy system to our new platform. This role requires a deep understanding of data structures, transformations, and migration strategies to ensure accuracy, consistency, and minimal business disruption. This is a mission-critical role for ensuring data quality and integrity in our transformation journey. Key Responsibilities: Design, implement, and manage large-scale data migration projects from legacy to modern systems. Analyze complex relational data models and create clear data mapping documentation. Develop and optimize robust ETL/ELT pipelines using appropriate tools and technologies. Cleanse, transform, and validate large datasets to ensure accuracy and consistency pre- and post-migration. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies, gaps, and performance bottlenecks during migration. Work cross-functionally with product, engineering, QA, and business stakeholders to gather requirements and validate results. Build migration audit trails and rollback procedures to support safe and traceable data transitions. Provide post-migration support, including monitoring, validation, and issue resolution. Document migration processes, scripts, mapping logic, and QA procedures clearly. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. Experience in data engineering, ETL development, or data migration projects. Proven experience with large data migrations involving complex schema relationships and business rules. Proficient in SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash). Experience with ETL tools such as Talend, Informatica, Apache NiFi, or custom scripting frameworks. Solid understanding of relational and non-relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB) Comfortable working with millions of records and optimizing performance in data pipelines. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to data quality, completeness, and integrity. Excellent communication and documentation skills. Good to have Experience in educational systems, ERP/CRM migration Familiarity with API-based data extraction/integration. Knowledge of data governance, compliance, and privacy standards (e.g., PDPA, GDPR). Familiarity with cloud services like AWS, GCP, or Azure for data storage and migration. What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to lead impactful, high-visibility projects. A supportive and collaborative team environment. Flexible work arrangements (depending on location and role).

Title: Documentation Business Analyst (AI-Assisted Knowledge Engineer)
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Skills: Business Analysis, ERP, API, Technical Writing, AI
Description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More About Kegmil Kegmil is a holistic solution provider of mission-critical Enterprise Systems, with a spike in Field Service Management software-as-a-service. We are a global team serving international clients, and strongly backed by Mitsubishi Electric (a world-leading manufacturer of products ranging from home electronics to satellite systems, headquartered in Japan) Our cloud-based, AI-enabled Field Service Management solution is #1 amongst B2B clients in Southeast Asia and is adopted across various industries such as Elevator & Escalator, Data Center, Medical Equipment, Defence & Aerospace, Marine Offshore, etc. Our offerings expand to Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems integration and deployment - including Inventory Management Systems (IMS), HR Information Systems (HRIS), Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Procurement Systems and others Location: Remote - HCM Department: Product & Engineering Reports to: VP of Product We are looking for a Documentation Business Analyst who combines strong system thinking, business rule understanding, and AI-assisted documentation techniques to build and maintain living system knowledge across our FSM SaaS platform. This role works at the intersection of Product, Engineering, QA, and Customer Support to ensure that complex system logic, rule engines, integration flows, and configurations are fully captured and easily referenceable for both internal and client-facing users. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with PO, Developers, QA, and CS to extract: Business rules System configurations Rule engine logic (YAML/JSON) Integration mapping (ERP, SAP, external APIs) Use structured templates and AI tooling to build documentation: Rule Specifications API Reference Configuration Matrix Workflow Diagrams (Mermaid.js / PlantUML) Client Help Articles Proactively identify knowledge gaps and drive clarification sessions. Maintain version-controlled documentation repository (Confluence + Git-based configs). Use AI tools to assist in drafting, version comparison, consistency checking, and automated doc generation. Ensure documentation remains synchronized with system releases, tenant customizations, and ongoing product evolution. Required Qualifications 2+ years experience as Business Analyst / System Analyst / Product Analyst in SaaS, ERP, or FSM domain. Strong system thinking and ability to map complex workflows and conditional logic. Comfortable reading technical configs (YAML, JSON, APIs, rule engines). Experience interviewing cross-functional teams to extract undocumented logic. Solid writing skills to translate technical logic into clear documentation. Familiar with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) for writing assistance. Familiar with documentation platforms (Confluence, Notion, Swagger, Git, Mermaid.js). Preferred Qualifications Exposure to ERP systems (SAP, MS Dynamics, Frappe, etc.). Experience with rule engines or configuration-driven platforms. Experience in knowledge management or knowledge ops design. Desired Skills and Experience Technical Writing, Business Analysis, SaaS

Title: Design Verification Senior / Staff Engineer in District 7, HCMC
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Skills: System Verilog, UVM, Verilog, Python, English
Description: About the job Alternate Job Titles: ASIC Design Verification Senior Engineer IP Verification Senior Engineer SoC Verification Senior Engineer Design Verification Staff Engineer We Are: At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation. You Are: You are a passionate and experienced Design Verification Engineer ready to take on new challenges in ASIC Design Verification for IP, Subsystem, or SoC. With a strong background in verification methodologies and a keen eye for detail, you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can collaborate with a global team of experts. Your proactive approach and excellent communication skills enable you to effectively debug and resolve complex issues. You are eager to innovate and contribute to the development of cutting-edge technologies that will be integrated into millions of SoCs used worldwide. Whether you are an engineer, lead, or manager, you are committed to continuous learning and growth, and you are excited about the opportunity to work with the industry's most advanced technology at Synopsys. What You’ll Be Doing: Define verification plans and build verification environments for block/sub-system level designs using Verilog, System Verilog, and UVM. Write test cases, checkers, and coverage that implement the verification test plan. Apply advanced verification techniques like constrained random generation, functional coverage, assertions, and formal verification. Work closely with RTL designers and other parts of our global verification team to debug failures. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the highest quality and performance of our IP solutions. Continuously improve verification processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. The Impact You Will Have: Ensure the robustness and reliability of our IP solutions, contributing to their successful integration into SoCs. Drive innovation and excellence in the design verification process, setting new standards for quality and performance. Support the development of high-speed, silicon-proven interface IP solutions in the latest process technology. Help accelerate the adoption of advanced technologies such as AI, autonomous vehicles, high-performance computing, cloud, 5G mobile, and IoT. Enhance the efficiency and productivity of our verification team through continuous improvement and collaboration. Contribute to the success of Synopsys and its customers by ensuring timely and high-quality delivery of IP solutions. What You’ll Need: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science. 2+ years of experience in design verification in the industry. Knowledge of one or more protocols such as AMBA, PCI-Express, CXL, UCIe, Ethernet, HBM, DDR, etc. Experience with industry-standard simulators, revision control systems, and regression systems. Proficiency in developing System Verilog, UVM, or similar HDL-based test environments. Strong programming skills in HDL, Verilog, System Verilog, C, Perl, and Python. Who You Are: A proactive and self-motivated team player. An excellent communicator with strong analytical skills. A detail-oriented professional with a passion for innovation and technology. Adaptable and able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Committed to continuous learning and professional development. The Team You’ll Be A Part Of: You will join our newly created Subsystem Verification Team in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. This team is composed of some of the industry’s most talented professionals, working together to create high-speed silicon-proven interface IP solutions. Our team is known for its personality, enthusiasm, and fun culture, with a strong emphasis on diversity and collaboration. You will have all the support you need to grow and develop with us, regardless of where you are in your career. Rewards and Benefits: We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Title: Principal Solutions Consultant
Location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
Skills: AI, Cloud, Solution Architecture, Stakeholder management, English
Description: About the job Solutions Consulting | Mid- Senior Modern tech solutions advisory & 'futurify’ consulting as a Searce business leader and a fds (‘forward deployed solver’) with revenue accountability from net-new accounts & intelligent client business outcomes responsibility. We designed the Job Description for this role like we design our solutions: Smart, Visual & Outcome-focused: Click here for Searce happier JD . What are we looking for real solver? Solver? Absolutely. But not the usual kind. We're searching for the architects of the audacious & the pioneers of the possible. If you're the type to dismantle assumptions, re-engineer ‘best practices,’ and build solutions that make the future possible NOW, then you're speaking our language. Improver. Solver. Futurist. Great sense of humor. ‘Possible. It is.’ Mindset. Compassionate collaborator. Bold experimenter. Tireless iterator. Natural creativity that doesn’t just challenge the norm, but solves to design what’s better. Thinks in systems. Solves at scale. This Isn’t for Everyone. But if you’re the kind who questions why things are done a certain way—and then identifies 3 better ways to do it — we’d love to chat with you. ______________________________________ Your Mission: The Role solving for better. You are a revenue-owning, outcome-delivering, forward-deployed solver (fds) leading AI-powered transformation from the first principles. You’ll be a Directly Responsible Individual (DRI) for co-innovating transformative business outcomes with the client stakeholders by solving differently & questioning the status quo. Let’s be clear: this is not your typical Partner role where success is measured in slide decks. At Searce, you get into the weeds, leading with a process-first mindset, as the fellow engineers evlos (solve differently) intelligent outcomes; while you remain 100% accountable for the solutions proposed & the real outcomes realized. If you’re a tech-savvy, consultative seller with the brain of a strategist, the heart of a builder, and the charisma of a storyteller — we’ve got a seat for you at the front of the table. You're not a sales/pre-sales manager. You're the transformation engine. ______________________________________ Your Responsibilities what you will wake up to solve. This isn’t a “manage the pipeline” role. You are the founder, the architect, and the DRI (Directly Responsible Individual) for generating and overseeing the real business outcomes for the net-new accounts and serving as a mentor & guide for Searce Solutions Consultants. Your mission is to partner with visionary clients, leverage our ‘solver DNA’ to disrupt traditional processes and genuinely futurify clients' business operations to create ‘real value’. You’re a forward-deployed solver who leads from the front—designing, influencing, and delivering AI-native, cloud-smart solutions for high-impact clients. You don’t just shape strategy—you bring it to life through engineering-first thinking and relentless problem-solving. Your mission: Partner with visionary clients. Translate complexity into clarity. Deliver intelligent outcomes that scale. Here’s how you’ll make your mark: Drive Intelligent Growth Own your portfolio: Take accountability for revenue generation and contribution across strategic accounts. Lead consultative engagements: Engage deeply with client CXOs to understand challenges and co-define transformation journeys. Execute GTM in context: Contribute to region/account-specific GTM strategy aligned with platform partners (hyperscalers, ISVs, AI players). Build value, not vanity: Prioritize solving real business problems over chasing buzzwords. Be the reason clients trust Searce. Architect What’s Next Lead discovery from first principles: Challenge assumptions, map root problems, and design intelligent transformation paths. Translate vision into action: Convert abstract client problems into concrete solution architectures that can scale. Design smarter, faster, better: Apply the evlos™ methodology to reimagine, redefine, and realize high-value solutions through iterative improvement. Solve with AI-native confidence: Build automation- and insight-led solutions that go beyond implementation and deliver sustained outcomes. Deliver Outcomes, Not Just Decks Be the transformation engine: Own the outcome from proposal to implementation—what you sell is what gets delivered. Land “pleasant surprises”: Bring ideas to life through working prototypes, compelling demos, and smart solutioning that wows without the fluff. Bridge tech and business: Align technical feasibility with business intent, helping clients realize ROI—not just TCO. Lead by Influence & Ownership Be the DRI: For your client’s outcomes, you're the Directly Responsible Individual. Level-up your team: Mentor fellow solvers, share your playbook, and grow the next wave of transformation leaders. Model “Always in Beta”: Stay curious. Iterate fast. Improve relentlessly—your learning curve should inspire others. Live the Searce way: Stay grounded in happier values. Be direct, be better, and solve like you mean it. ______________________________________ Welcome to Searce The ‘process-first’, AI-native modern tech consultancy that's rewriting the rules. We don’t do traditional. As an engineering-led consultancy, we are dedicated to relentlessly improving the real business outcomes. Our solvers co-innovate with clients to futurify operations and make processes smarter, faster & better. We build alongside our clients. Not for the vanity metrics. But for the transformation to embed lasting competitive advantage for our clients. The result? Modern business reinvention, built on math, tech, and clarity of purpose ______________________________________ Functional Skills Strategic Solutioning & Revenue Ownership: Architects growth-driving solutions while owning deal closure, delivery quality, and profitability within a defined portfolio. CxO Storytelling with Technical Integrity: Leads strategic conversations with clarity and conviction—translating complex technologies into tangible business impact. Negotiation & Influence: Facilitates decisions through intelligent co-creation—balancing business value with client context to achieve win-win outcomes. Process-First Leadership: Reimagines workflows by exposing inefficiencies, designing intelligent processes, and driving continuous transformation. Evlos-Driven Execution: Applies Searce’s iterative, feedback-rich methodology to build fast, improve faster, and deliver intelligent outcomes. Portfolio Leadership: Manages client accounts with precision—forecasting accurately, executing reliably, and proactively resolving escalations. Team & Culture Contributor: Champions performance culture by mentoring talent, modeling ownership, and driving collaborative momentum across teams. Tech Superpowers AI-native fluency: Knows when to fine-tune, when to prompt, and how to turn models into outcomes. ‘Three sentence prompt’ with double quotes is not really a prompt. It's a search. Modern Tech Consultant DNA: Applied AI Engineering, Cloud Engineering, Data Intelligence, Work Modernization, Process modernization — not just the buzzwords, but the real understanding of how these offerings create ‘business value’ for various functional areas in specific domains. More than cloud-certified, cloud-capable. Proven impact through cloud and AI-led solutioning, with the ability to assess trade-offs and position the right tools for the right outcomes. Sees tech through a business lens. Connects architecture to outcomes. Turns business process flowcharts into future-ready solutions. Product-mindset meets consulting depth: Designs for scale, not one-offs. Reimagines ‘what’s next’: Searcians don’t just admire ‘what’s new’; our solvers impact-engineer ‘the new’ to redefine immediate value for an enterprise with a 9-month actionable roadmap that realizes a $10 Mn outcome. Experience & Relevance Consulting Pedigree: Demonstrates profound expertise (10+ years) in business technology & outcome consulting, successfully spearheading complex modernization journeys on modern CSP tech stacks. Commercial Leadership: Exhibits proven capability to directly drive net-new services business in specific domains or key engagements, delivering substantial contributions to revenue targets. Client-Facing Tech Acumen: Possesses established mastery (8+ years) as a trusted technical advisor in client-facing pre-sales or solution architecting roles, independently shaping and guiding strategic client proposals. Locally Tuned: Commands a sophisticated understanding of the local terrain—clients, partners, and platform strategies—enabling expert navigation and the proactive identification of substantial, actionable opportunities. Bonus Points (you will thrive if you have) Brings founder energy: high ownership, relentless execution, and bias for real-world impact. Have led transformation at scale — think journeys for $1Bn+ enterprises; beyond slideware. Solved for horizontal automation: P2P, claims, HR — not in theory, but in production. 0→1, 1→10: You know what it takes to scale with speed and intent. Early-stage leader in a growth company? Taken an analytics / modern consulting business from $x to $y Mn. You default to Build , not present; Solve , not posture; Deliver, not debate. Impact over optics and solving for real outcomes over ‘we’ve always done it this way.’

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Ruby) - AI Trainer

What We Do The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe. Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Web Designer & Digital Marketer (Figma - Webflow - Framer) - HCMC
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Skills: Figma, A/B testing, HTML, CSS, English
Description: About the job This position is onsite at our office in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. About OptiSigns OptiSigns is a Houston-based B2B SaaS company that helps more than 30,500 businesses engage customers and employees through intuitive digital-screen solutions. We believe great software—and the websites that market it—should be clear, modern, and conversion-focused. Why this role exists Our marketing site is the first touchpoint for thousands of prospects each week. We're looking for a Web Designer who can translate business goals into high-impact, high-converting pages—then ship them fast with no-code tools. What You'll Do 40% - Design clean, on-brand web experiences in Figma—from wireframes to polished mock-ups and component libraries. 40% - Build & launch those designs in Webflow or Framer, leveraging their native CMS, interactions, and performance features. 10% - Optimize conversion: set up A/B tests, iterate on copy/layout, and analyze metrics (GA4, Hotjar) to grow demo sign-ups and trials. 10% - Collaborate with marketing, product, and sales on campaigns, landing pages, and content hubs that tell a compelling story. Requirements What you bring 3+ years designing and shipping marketing websites for SaaS or e-commerce. Mastery of Figma, plus production fluency in Webflow or Framer. Strong grasp of modern, minimal visual style, typography, spacing, and responsive best practices. Business mindset—comfortable reading funnel metrics, aligning design decisions with revenue goals, and presenting trade-offs to stakeholders. Hands-on CRO know-how: A/B testing, copy hierarchy, CTAs, and user-journey mapping. Familiarity with SEO basics, page-speed optimization, and accessibility (WCAG 2.2). Excellent written & verbal communication; ability to defend design rationale with data Bonus points Experience building gated-content workflows (HubSpot, Marketo, or similar). Experience with JavaScript, HTML/CSS to tweak beyond no-code constraints Benefits Opportunity to travel and work at our U.S. office in Houston, TX Latest Macbook Pro Competitive Pay Company Trip Paid time off Insurance Opportunity to travel and work at our U.S. office in Houston, TX Latest Macbook Pro Competitive Pay Company Trip Paid time off Insurance Our VN Office address: DC Tower, 111D Ly Chinh Thang, Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3 Ho Chi Minh City

Title: Data Engineer
Skills: Python, Pandas, AWS, PostgreSql, ETL
Description: About the job Established in 2012, VMO Holdings (VMO) is a leading provider of professional IT services with a team of 1,200 employees, operating 6 offices in Vietnam and 5 international branches in Japan, Thailand & Singapore. In 2025, VMO officially became a member of the Alten Group, a global leader in Engineering and IT Services with a presence in 30 countries. Completing the VMO ecosystem and focusing on core values in all VMO activities will be the basis for us to confidently empower and trust the next generation. Each member of VMO should always set new goals for themselves, change their mindset, develop themselves and their organization to join VMO in conquering all challenges and developing sustainably in the future. Responsibilities: We are seeking a Data Engineer to develop a scalable, production-ready data pipeline for ESG Social reporting. This role focuses on processing a high volume of small CSV/XLSX files with inconsistent schemas, ensuring data quality, traceability, and reliability in an AWS environment. - Ingest and validate semi-structured CSV/XLSX files from Amazon S3 - Clean, normalize, and transform data using Python (Pandas) - Handle schema drift, extra/missing columns, and encoding discrepancies - Track file-level data completeness and implement data lineage - Persist cleaned datasets into PostgreSQL or Amazon Redshift - Orchestrate ETL workflows using Airflow, AWS Glue, or Step Functions - Build logging, monitoring, and robust error-handling mechanisms Qualifications: - 1.5+ years of experience with Python and Pandas for ETL - Proficiency with AWS services: S3, Glue, Lambda, Step Functions - Solid understanding of workflow orchestration tools (Airflow or AWS-native) - Experience managing schema evolution and data validation - Proficient in writing queries and managing data in PostgreSQL or Redshift - Strong software engineering principles: modularity, testing, version control - Bonus: Familiarity with ESG data or reporting standards - English: Fluent 4 skills BENEFITS Working time: 8.30 am – 5.30 pm from Monday to Friday. OPPORTUNITIES AND CHALLENGES: Opportunity to work in a professional, modern and energizing setting. Challenging projects, possibilities, cutting-edge technology, and problems. An open and dynamic working atmosphere that promotes the interchange of ideas, while also empowering you to work and create in your own style. Each employee's talent and accomplishments are valued, and outstanding employees are recognized and rewarded on a yearly basis. Opportunities for capacity development, as well as assistance with professional certification expenses, are available to those who work in the field (1 million - 5 million). Some advanced certifications will cover the full cost of studying and taking the exam. ATTRACTIVE REWARDING POLICY AND WORK-LIFE BALANCE: Fixed salary: negotiable + project bonus + 13 th salary bonus Review salary 1-2 times/year, with the possibility of an unexpected salary rise based on capacity an infinite number of times per year Policy for 13th-Month Salary Bonus and Holiday Bonuses According to Company Regulations. Holiday travel mode (package 5-7 million/person), team building,... Full participation in social insurance, as well as a yearly health checkup at a reputable hospital. Comprehensive visit policy for personnel and relatives: birthday, marriage, childbirth, illness, etc. The football club, cycling car, badminton, ... are just a few of the sports and cultural activities available. Allowance for classes and training awards: Learning Star of the Month, A chance to be the face of the year's study, the royalties... APPLY FOR POSITION Send your CV to: hoantm@vmogroup.com (Ms. Hoa Nguyen) Telegram: @Minhhoami Location: Cau Giay, Hanoi

Title: [Cầu Giấy, HN] CSCMobi tuyển dụng Game Designer
Skills: Games, Firebase, Data Analysis, English, Technical Writing
Description: About the job 1. Mô tả công việc – Tìm hiểu, nghiên cứu thị trường và xu hướng game mới – Thiết kế bộ tài liệu game design đầy đủ về tính năng, nội dung, level, giao diện, âm thanh… – Tham gia triển khai dự án, kiểm soát chất lượng sản phẩm, vận hành và tối ưu các chỉ số cơ bản – Phân tích, đánh giá và cân bằng game. – Theo dõi, báo cáo và đưa ra các giải pháp tối ưu cho dự án. – Hỗ trợ team marketing chuẩn bị các tài liệu trong giai đoạn phát hành sản phẩm. 2. Yêu cầu – Trên 6 tháng kinh nghiệm làm Game Design và đam mê chơi game, làm game. – Đã tham gia các dự án Puzzle, Casual, Midcore… – Có kiến thức, kinh nghiệm sử dụng các công cụ hỗ trợ triển khai dự án như firebase, analystic – Có kinh nghiệm test, kiểm soát chất lượng đầu ra – Có kiến thức chuyên môn tốt về: User experience, User behavior, Level design, Progression design, Monetization design – Thành thạo các công cụ làm tài liệu thiết kế game: word/excel, mind map, mockup/wireframe… – Có tư duy logic và tinh thần trách nhiệm cao trong công việc 3. Quyền lợi: – Lương: up to 2000$ – Nhiều hạng mục thưởng hấp hẫn: Thưởng tháng, thưởng doanh thu, thưởng quản lý/chuyên gia, thưởng thành thích và thưởng các dịp lễ Tết, sinh nhật công ty… – Lộ trình thăng tiến rõ ràng, minh bạch – Môi trường làm việc trẻ trung, năng động và thân thiện – Được chủ động đề xuất các ý tưởng cải tiến sản phẩm và chiến lược phát triển sản phẩm. – Được phát huy tối đa khả năng sáng tạo của bản thân. – Được nghỉ phép 14 ngày/năm và được tham gia ít nhất 2 kì nghỉ của công ty: du lịch hè và teambuilding cuối năm. – Chế độ nhà nước đầy đủ 4. Hồ sơ bao gồm – CV nêu rõ kinh nghiệm làm việc – Link các sản phẩm. Vui lòng gửi CV về email: hr@cscmobi.com

Title: Senior consultant - Cyber Security
Skills: Penetration Testing, Vulnerability Assessment, OWASP, Cybersecurity, English
Description: About the job Senior Consultant for Cyber Security & Privacy services, Ho Chi Minh City We are PwC, a global professional services company and a Big Four firm . We are seeking candidates who have experience in penetration testing, red teaming or secure source-code review/development for the role of Senior Consultant within the Cybersecurity and Privacy team . The role may be based either at our Ho Chi Minh City office. Joining PwC, the successful candidate will have opportunities to collaborate with cybersecurity experts throughout the PwC global network and deliver cybersecurity services for clients in various sectors. Work in a highly innovative and transformative business Work/life balance with access to flexible work arrangements Salary packaging – to suit your personal and financial circumstances Professional certification sponsorship – to develop your talent and enhance knowledge What will your typical day look like? Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organisation that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture? Responsibilities: Lead the team in cybersecurity assessments, covering web application and mobile application penetration testing in accordance with OWASP Top 10 framework and CWE Top 25 most dangerous software weaknesses Lead the team in network penetration tests and vulnerability assessments to identify potential issues against network access control and network segmentation Conduct source code reviews to identify potential logical errors in program flows, misconfigurations, and exploitable vulnerabilities in the applications Conduct red teaming engagement and cyber-attack simulation testing to assess clients ’ cybersecurity strategies Research, collect and analyse cyber threat intelligence from threat actors Engage in establishing network infrastructure for red teaming activities, including but not limited to command & control ("C2") servers, SMTP relay mail servers, web servers, and reverse proxies Design and launch phishing attacks to generate reports for increasing awareness of employees regarding different types of phishing techniques Provide pragmatic recommendations on the identified risks Deliver both management - level and detailed technical reporting of observations, along with assisting in giving presentations to both technical and business stakeholders Deliver complex Cybersecurity consulting and engineering projects involving diverse technologies, and multidisciplinary delivery teams and stakeholder groups Collaborate with clients, colleagues, and technology alliance partners on identifying and developing solutions for assessing and enhancing cyber security operations Engage with threat intelligence, hunting, and incident response activities to keep up to date with trends in technology, security, and the threat landscape Train, coach and mentor junior team members Lead day-to-day delivery activities, including client and internal communication management, as well as technical quality control Work actively in supporting and following up on proposal processing in accordance with client expectations on a cross-border and global multinational basis Continuously research and follow up on the latest IT security challenges and technologies (mobile, digital trust, IoT, cloud, blockchain etc . ) You are someone with: 3+ years of proven experience in conducting either network and infrastructure or web/API or mobile application penetration testing and be able to independently manage engagement delivery Experience in leading and supervising engagement teams in penetration testing and vulnerability assessment projects Thorough understanding of common infrastructure and web application vulnerabilities and common vulnerability categorisations such as OWASP and CVSS Knowledge of common software security vulnerabilities (CWE Top 25 Most Dangerous Software Weaknesses) Experience in penetration testing and vulnerability assessment across one of the several following domains: web and mobile applications, cloud and container security, reverse engineering, applied cryptography, networks infrastructure, etc. Ability to work under pressure and deliver quality work in tight timelines Demonstrated experience of working with diverse stakeholders Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Willingness to take on new challenges, gain new skills and work collaboratively in a dynamic and rapidly growing team One of the following industry certifications: OSCP, OSWA, eWPT, eCPPT, CRTP, PNPT, CREST CRT/CCT, or equivalent Preferred: Experience in conducting red teaming engagements and cyber-attack simulation testing Experience in developing hacking scripts/tools Secure development and/or DevSecOps experience, including experience of securing code before deployment, code review, and vulnerability and dependency management Ability to communicate strategic information security topics, policies, and standards as well as risk-related concepts to technical and non - technical audiences Experience in bug bounty programs or CVE hunting is an advantage Preference will be given to candidates who hold relevant cloud certifications: AWS, Azure, GCP Strong preference will be given to candidates who hold one of the following industry certifications: OSWE, OSEP, OSCE, CRTO, CRTE, eCPTX, eWPTX, SANS Strong preference will be given to candidates who hold one of the following professional certifications: CISSP, CCSP, CSSLP, CISM, CRISC, PMP

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Salary: Lương tháng + Thưởng KPI (20% lương tháng); Gói thu nhập lên đến 18 tháng lương/năm
Skills: DevSecOps, Kubernetes, GitLab, GitOps, English
Description: About the job 📌 MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC: Triển khai các dự án về Quy trình DevSecOps cho các khách hàng trong lĩnh vực Tài chính, Ngân hàng (MB, VP, VIB, TCB…), Bảo hiểm và Chứng khoán. Tư vấn các giải pháp phù hợp với nhu cầu của khách hàng dựa trên các dòng sản phẩm của Redhat hoặc VMware. Phối hợp với chuyên gia hãng (Redhat, VMware…) thiết kế hệ thống DevSecOps Pipeline, Automation theo các yêu cầu của khách hàng. Thực hiện triển khai các giải pháp đã xây dựng. Lập tài liệu cho các công việc liên quan đến quá trình triển khai. Nghiên cứu các giải pháp, công nghệ phần mềm theo định hướng của công ty. Hướng dẫn, đào tạo, hỗ trợ các nhân sự Junior/Fresher. 📌 YÊU CẦU: Trình độ học vấn: Tốt nghiệp ĐH chuyên ngành CNTT hoặc Điện tử Viễn thông. Kinh nghiệm: Có ít nhất 2 năm kinh nghiệm làm việc (Thiết kế, Triển khai, Cài đặt, Vận hành...) với một trong các Container platform: Redhat Openshift hoặc VMware Tanzu hoặc Kubernetes. Có ít nhất 03 năm kinh nghiệm tham gia vào các dự án sử dụng quy trình phát triển DevSecOps, CI/CD với các công cụ GitLab, GitOps, Prisma Cloud… Ưu tiên các ứng viên có chứng chỉ CKAD hoặc DevSecOps Practioner. Kỹ năng: Có khả năng giao tiếp & đọc hiểu tài liệu kỹ thuật tiếng Anh. Kỹ năng ứng xử, giao tiếp, thuyết trình tốt. Kỹ năng giải quyết vấn đề và làm việc theo nhóm. Có khả năng làm việc độc lập, chủ động, trách nhiệm, nhiệt tình trong công việc. 📌 CHẾ ĐỘ ĐÃI NGỘ: Thu nhập tháng: Lương tháng + Thưởng KPI (20% lương tháng); Gói thu nhập lên đến 18 tháng lương/năm. Các hoạt động khen thưởng định kỳ (tháng/quý/chương trình/ thành tích đặc biệt) như: “Man of the month”, “Sáng kiến cải tiến”, Nhân viên/ team/ bộ phận/ phòng ban xuất sắc; Thưởng khi hoàn thành các khóa đào tạo/chứng chỉ chuyên môn. Từ 05 – 20 triệu tùy thành tích và cơ cấu từng giải thưởng Bảo hiểm sức khỏe Bảo Việt toàn diện hàng năm; Thưởng các dịp Lễ, Tết, Sinh nhật, Hỷ… 26.000.000đ/người/năm, lương tháng thứ 13; Chế độ nghỉ mát/ Innovation/ Teambuilding hàng năm; Gói Khám sức khỏe định kỳ lên đến 2.500.000 VNĐ/người/năm; Bữa sáng, bữa trưa miễn phí tại công ty Quỹ đào tạo, phát triển, hỗ trợ thi chứng chỉ quốc tế 3000$/người/năm 📌 THÔNG TIN LIÊN HỆ: Hoàng Hiệp - Talent Acquisition Phone/Zalo/Whatsapp: 0989223519 Email: hiep.ah@amigo.vn

Title: Operations Team Leader (Chinese Language)
Skills: Team Management, Leadership, Communication Skills, Chinese, English
Description: About the job Concentrix, a wholly-owned subsidiary of SYNNEX Corporation (NYSE: SNX), is a leading business services company. We focus on customer engagement and improving business outcomes for over 450 global clients across six continents. Our 100,000+ staff deliver technology-infused, omni-channel customer experience management, marketing optimization, digital, consulting, analytics, and back office solutions in 40+ languages from 125+ delivery centers. We serve automotive; banking and financial services; insurance; healthcare; technology; consumer electronics; media and communications; retail and ecommerce; travel and transportation; and energy and public sector clients. Visit www.concentrix.com to learn more Location: The position will relocate to KL, Malaysia Job Description Essential Functions/Core Responsibilities Responsible for the day-to-day supervision of a group of call center associates including work and attendance monitoring in accordance with organization policy and applicable legal requirements Effectively coach direct reports on their performance on a regular basis to ensure performance metrics are achieved at a minimum weekly Identify performance related issues, develop an action plan for improvement, implement corrective action, up to and including termination of employment Ensure service delivered to our customers meets contractual Key Performance Indicator (‘KPIs’) and financial expectations Communicate expectations to employees and provide timely updates Provide subject matter expertise in handling escalated customer calls as needed Conduct Team Meetings to ensure expedient communication of relevant information and as an open forum for input. Schedule and organize team activities Stay current on internal work processes, policies and procedures. Attend required manager development training Promote the Concentrix values through both behavior and attitude, including being an advocate for team members Candidate Profile Having experience in leading team (>10 members) Excellent in Chinese Language (prefer having certification on HSK5,6) English b1 & above Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to lead team in multi-tasking, prioritization, and meeting timelines on deliverable Ability to mentor, coach and provide direction to a team of employees Willingness to work a flexible schedule Career Level Description . Manage the employment status of call center associates and participate in the transfer, promotions or regularization of call center associates, which is necessary before any such employee-movement is made Exercises independent judgment and discretion in the performance of the said main function as a means to implement management policies Exercises authority to manage the employment status of a group of employees (firing, promotion, regularization, etc.) including identifying and addressing misconduct, policy and process violations of call center associates Stay current on internal work processes, management policies and procedures and ensures implementation of the same Implement management policies Support and manage the program together with other Team Leaders and Managers Providing input into selecting, training, developing, and completing performance appraisal of work group(s) in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable legal requirements Manage team members on their performance on a regular basis, and write and deliver performance appraisal. The Team Leader’s role is a managerial level position, a position reposed with trust and confidence.

Title: Chuyên gia, Chuyên viên cao cấp Kiến trúc ứng dụng - Solution Architect - Khối Công nghệ thông tin (HOLT.10)
Skills: Java, Python, Spring, MySQL, English
Description: About the job Job Description: Lead the design and solution development for products, meeting business requirements and complying with architectural and technology standards: Clarify requirements and advise business stakeholders and BAs on the project scope. Develop overall design solutions to address business problems. Collaborate with Application Architects (AAs) to create detailed designs solving business issues. Work with AAs to ensure developments comply with the design. Participate in building MB’s Reference Architecture: Join teams with Enterprise Architects (EAs) and Application Architects (AAs) to develop design patterns, decision trees, guidelines, and sample code that meet standards and design principles. Participate in planning activities: Provide information and conduct current state surveys to support planning. Participate in evaluating and proposing planning solutions. Other tasks: Review incidents related to assigned systems/solutions. Coordinate with stakeholders to propose and determine system sizing. Participate in testing and evaluating new technologies. Job Requirement: Graduated from university in Information Technology, Mathematics, Telecommunications Electronics from reputable universities such as Polytechnic University, National University, or hold an equivalent international programming certification. Minimum 4 years of experience in software programming and design. Knowledgeable in multiple programming languages: Java, Go, Python, etc. Good understanding of frameworks such as Spring, Angular, React, Go-zero, etc. Strong knowledge of various databases: Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, etc. Good understanding of platform applications and deployment architectures: Redis, Kafka, Google Cloud (GG), etc. Well-versed in architecture models: Monolithic, Microservices, Serverless, Event-Driven, and other models like Mini frontend, Miniapp. Deep understanding of application design from multiple aspects such as integration, security, and network planning. Knowledge and practical experience with development methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, etc. Experience working on private cloud, public cloud platforms, and containerization platforms. Position is open for senior developers aiming to transition into Solution Architect roles. English language proficiency: TOEIC score of at least 550.

Title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (.net, AWS)
Location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
Skills: Python, TypeScript, C#, Agile, Git
Description: About the job 💼 Senior Fullstack Developer – Cloud Application Project | SCC Vietnam 📍 Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam | 💻 Hybrid/Remote-friendly 🚀 Join a European tech leader driving cloud innovation in Post Office systems ⸻ 🔍 About the Role We’re looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer to join our Vietnam-based team, working on a large-scale cloud-based system for Post Office (UK). You will lead a team of developers, collaborate with Architects & Product Owners, and deliver robust, scalable, and secure software solutions. This is a senior role ideal for someone ready to own the codebase, remove blockers, and bridge technical conversations between devs and architects. ⸻ 🧠 What You’ll Do • Lead the technical delivery of cloud-native applications. • Design, build, and maintain high-performing services (serverless/microservices). • Collaborate closely with cross-functional Scrum teams across Vietnam, UK, and France. • Implement DevOps best practices, CI/CD pipelines. • Champion code quality, documentation, and innovation. • Troubleshoot and resolve production-level issues. • Stay updated on AI, Data, and emerging cloud tech (yes, we love Co-pilot too). • Promote a culture of continuous improvement and mentoring. ⸻ 🧰 Your Skills & Experience ✅ Must-have: • 5+ years’ experience in software development, preferably in cloud environments. • Strong experience with Python, TypeScript, or C#. • Cloud platform knowledge (AWS, Azure, or GCP) – certification is a plus. • Experience with Agile/Scrum, Git, and DevOps practices. • Excellent problem-solving, team leadership, and communication skills. • Good English – verbal & written – for daily work with UK team. 🪄 Nice-to-have: • Experience with AI/ML concepts, Data Analytics, Data Warehouse. • Familiarity with Webdriver.io or Selenium for automation testing. • Experience with Power BI or cloud dashboards is a bonus. ⸻ 👥 Who You’ll Work With • Report to VN/UK Technical Architect. • Cross-site collaboration with UK, Romania, and France tech teams. ⸻ 🌍 About SCC Vietnam SCC (Specialist Computer Centres) is a UK-based IT leader operating in over 50 countries with 2,500+ enterprise customers. In Vietnam, we build critical software systems, infrastructure support, and digital transformation services for our UK & French clients. ⸻ 🎁 What We Offer • Competitive salary, performance bonus & 13th-month salary. • Premium healthcare (includes dependents), annual health check. • Hybrid working policy & international exposure. • Travel insurance, annual trip, training & certifications support. ⸻ 🚀 Ready to join a team that builds systems powering the UK’s national infrastructure?

As a fast-growing company, we’re looking for talented individuals who are passionate about technology, eCommerce, and making a real impact. If you're ready to join a dynamic team and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you! About the Role AutoDS is looking for a customer-oriented and tech-savvy Billing Support Specialist to join our Customer Experience team, reporting to the Billing Support Manager. In this role, you’ll act as a key point of contact for our users, providing product and service information while resolving billing issues accurately and efficiently. You’ll bring patience, empathy, and excellent communication skills to every interaction, advocating for users and ensuring a high standard of service. This is a deeply technical role, and you'll be expected to develop strong expertise in our platform and tools. Key Responsibilities Manage a high volume of billing-related incoming online chats and support tickets Identify and assess customers' needs to ensure satisfaction Build trust and rapport with customers through open and clear communication Provide accurate, complete, and timely information using appropriate methods and tools Handle complaints, provide effective solutions and alternatives within set timeframes Document customer interactions thoroughly to maintain accurate records and assist internal teams Follow all communication procedures, guidelines, and policies Develop a deep understanding of AutoDS’s platform and functionalities to provide expert technical support, keeping up to date with changes and improvements made Go the extra mile to engage and delight customers Requirements: Proven billing customer support experience (technical preferred) Strong technical aptitude, with eagerness to learn new platforms and tools Familiarity with CRM systems and standard support practices Excellent communication and presentation skills in English (spoken and written) Customer-focused, adaptable, and able to handle a range of personalities and situations Strong multitasking abilities, with excellent time management and prioritisation skills Ability to work full-time shifts and flexibility regarding scheduling Fully remote role—requires a reliable computer and a stable internet connection Nice to Have Experience in eCommerce, dropshipping, or SaaS environments Familiarity with Shopify, eBay, Amazon, and other major selling channels Previous experience working remotely or with international teams Ready to take your career to the next level with AutoDS ? Join us and be part of a global team that’s driving the future of eCommerce innovation. Apply today and help us create cutting-edge solutions for online sellers worldwide!

Efforts require refactoring existing logic, feasibility analysis, and creating new enhancements. · Collaborate with business analysts, testing, and other development teams to ensure solutions are efficient, consistent, and fulfill business needs. · Perform design and analysis on efforts before starting development. · Author technical documents for software architecture or design as required. · Participate in design reviews, code reviews, and collaborative requirements reviews. · Apply generally accepted programming standards and techniques to ensure efficient performance and data manipulation. · Attendance during regular workhours and overtime as required. · Collaborate with multiple global teams to contribute to a large-scale project. Required Qualifications: · Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or related field. Additional, equivalent work experience may be substituted for the degree requirement · 2+ years of hands-on experience with C#, .NET, and Windows Forms application development. · Knowledge of data structures and strong understanding of object-oriented principles · Comfortable digging into large, unfamiliar codebases to diagnose, debug, and resolve critical issues · Familiarity with Azure DevOps for project management and source control. · Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and the ability to communicate in both technical and business terms. (English level B2 - CEFR or equivalent) Preferred Qualifications: · Understanding of mathematical concepts involving algebra and geometry · Understanding of SCRUM and Agile principles to collaborate effectively in a team environment. Why you'll love working here · Extremely competitive salary. · 13th month & productivity Bonus. · Yearly salary review. · Healthcare insurance package. · 24/24 Personal accident insurance. · State-of-the-art office environment. · Yearly outing. · Detailed induction, training and on-going career development. · Opportunity for overseas training and travel. · English training programs. · 5-day week. · Flexible start-times. · Free lunch. · Free parking. · Full Social Club including gym, zumba, yoga, football, badminton, swimming.

Title: Project Manager - Japanese Speaking
Location: Hà Nội Old Quarter, Hanoi, Vietnam
Skills: Project Management, Stakeholder management, Communication, Business Analysis, Japanese
Description: About the job Make an impact with NTT DATA Join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. Our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion – it’s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive. Your day at NTT DATA The Client Project Manager is a seasoned subject matter expert, responsible for leading and directing concurrent client projects classified as standard or complex. The primary responsibility of the Client Project Manager is to interface with all project stakeholders to take projects from original concept through to final implementation, including handing over to Operations (whether internal to the organization or into the client's support operations). Key responsibilities: Leads and directs concurrent standard or complex projects. Engages with stakeholders to deliver projects from original concept through final implementation. Ensures client satisfaction and manage escalations, acting as a single point of contact to the client. Ensures that the project delivers an as-sold solution, remains within the baselined budget and is delivered on time whilst maintaining quality criteria and client satisfaction. Manages the delivery of the project, including rigorous scope control and change management. Ensures client satisfaction and manage escalations, acting as a single point of contact to the client. Documentation and management of risks and issues. Ensures clear and concise communications to all stakeholders. Provides pre-sales support by working with sales teams to scope and cost a project solution which includes the completion of a proposal. This may include Client presentations of our delivery approach as part of a tender process. Identifies opportunities and influences the sale by conducting a business conversation with the client positioning organizational consulting and technical services offerings. Coordinates activities of the project teams through task delegation or resource assignment etc. Performs any other related task as required. To thrive in this role, you need to have: Seasoned project management skills, including the ability to plan, organize, and execute projects from initiation to completion. Ability to establish strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external clients. Ability to manage customer satisfaction, commitment, and expectations to high service levels and manage escalations adequately. Good written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work in high-pressure environments. Seasoned ability to manage urgent and complex tasks simultaneously. Seasoned business acumen and commercial skills. Passionate, strong initiative, self-driven with a commitment to succeed. Seasoned influencing ability whilst taking a collaborative approach. Decisive with good attention to detail ability. Seasoned ability to promote project services to both internal stakeholders and external clients. Competent in project change management. Seasoned knowledge of the industry, domain, or technology related to the client's project. Seasoned problem-solving and analytical skills to identify and address issues that may arise during project implementation. Qualifications and experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or any other IT-related fields. More than 7 years’ experience in software development and 1 ~ 2 years’ experience in project management. 4~6 years’ experience in Java Enterprise Application or Microservice development, preferably using popular Java development framework / tools such as Spring framework, JPA, JMS 2~3 years’ experience in any of Oracle/MS SQL/Postgresql Experience to manage developement of ERP/Production/Data & Intelligence/Service Now/Intramart project as a plus. Excellent Japanese (JLPT N1/N2) Good design documentation is required. Able to build team work spirit and always continuous motivating subordinates. Project Management Professional (PMP) Certificate is a plus. Japanese company experience is preferable.. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. We invest over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. Title: UiPath Solution Architect / Technical Lead
Skills: UiPath, Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate, RPA, English
Description: About the job PROJECT DESCRIPTIONS We are looking for an experienced UiPath Solution Architect / Technical Lead with a strong background in designing and managing large-scale RPA solutions, coupled with hands-on experience migrating automation from UiPath to Microsoft Power Platform . The role requires deep knowledge of UiPath’s architecture, capabilities, and best practices, as well as working knowledge of Power Automate, Power Apps, and related Microsoft technologies. You will be responsible for guiding the migration process, mapping and redesigning automation workflows, and leading cross-functional teams through successful transition and optimization. JOB DESCRIPTIONS Lead the technical assessment and migration planning of automation assets from UiPath to Microsoft Power Platform. Analyze and document existing UiPath workflows, bots, queues, and orchestrations to determine equivalency in Power Automate and Power Apps. Redesign or refactor RPA workflows using Power Automate Desktop (for attended/unattended bots) and Power Automate Cloud Flows. Collaborate with Microsoft Power Platform teams (Solution Architects, Developers) to ensure seamless migration and modernization. Identify redundant or overly complex automation and recommend simplification or reimplementation using native Microsoft 365 features. Provide technical leadership and mentor developers across both UiPath and Power Platform teams. Establish best practices, documentation, and governance for automation development during and after migration. Support CI/CD, test automation, and environment setup for both UiPath and Power Platform pipelines. JOB QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 7+ years of experience in enterprise automation projects, including: 4+ years in UiPath (including Orchestrator, REFramework, Studio) 2+ years with Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate Desktop/Cloud, Power Apps) Strong command of: UiPath components: queues, triggers, exception handling, selectors, attended/unattended bots Power Platform components: Dataverse, Power Automate RPA, standard connectors Workflow optimization, parallelization, exception handling, and retry logic Knowledge of process assessment and redesign, especially during platform transitions. Experience with REST APIs, JSON/XML handling, authentication protocols (OAuth2), and integration with enterprise systems (ERP, CRM, etc.). Hands-on experience with Power Platform ALM, Git, Azure DevOps pipelines, and deployment strategies. Certifications: UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer (or equivalent) PL-500: Microsoft Power Automate RPA Developer PL-400/PL-600: Developer or Architect-level Power Platform certification Experience leading automation centers of excellence (CoE) or participating in governance/compliance teams. Understanding of Microsoft ecosystem (SharePoint, Teams, Excel, Outlook) and how they interact with both UiPath and Power Platform. Familiarity with industry-specific compliance requirements (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR) related to automation. Good English speaking & listening. BENEFITS Attractive salary. Performance based award. Go onsite in Singapore. Young and dynamic working environment. Continuous development of hard and soft skills through work and professional trainings. Exciting leisure: sport and art events (football club, family day...) Company's labor policy completely pursuant to Vietnamese labor legislation plus other benefits offered by the company (Company trip, Holiday, etc.)

Title: Cobol Developer (Middle/Senior)
Skills: COBOL, DB2, Database, English, Business Analysis
Description: About the job Who are we? Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success. At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like: Brief Call : Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you! Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities! Case study : Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc. As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience. We look forward to meeting you! Job Description ABOUT THE JOB Design, develop, and maintain COBOL/COBOLII/eCOBOL applications, ensuring optimal performance and scalability. Work with Smart 400 and Business Object (BO of CSC) tools to deliver business solutions. Develop and manage DB2 databases, ensuring data integrity and high availability. Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and gather system requirements, ensuring solutions meet business needs. Provide ongoing support and maintenance for life insurance-related applications. Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing COBOL applications in a timely manner. Participate in all stages of the software development lifecycle, including design, coding, testing, and deployment. Ensure that developed applications are in line with company best practices and security standards. Collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical stakeholders. Support and contribute to the Life Asia system, ensuring alignment with business objectives and system requirements. About You ⁠Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. From 3-5 years of experience working with COBOL programming language Strong hand-on experience in Smart 400 and Business Object (BO of CSC), with experience in COBOLII/eCOBOL. Hand-on experience working with DB2 databases. Experience in the life insurance industry is highly preferred, with familiarity in Life Asia systems. ⁠Experience with mainframe programming and working on legacy systems. Ability to adapt quickly to changing requirements and project timelines. Knowledge of industry best practices in coding, testing, and debugging. ⁠Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work well under high-pressure environments. ⁠Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to work effectively within a team. WHY AMARIS? 13th-month salary 14+ annual leaves per year Premium healthcare insurance, starting from your probation period Project reviews and yearly performance appraisals Annual company trips Teambuilding activities: Team lunch/dinner, events, and celebrations, sports clubs (football, yoga, badminton, etc.) International team with flexible working time + hybrid working Tailor-made career path Technical workshops and training courses Mobility: Opportunities to be on-site abroad in our offices in over 60+ countries Equal Opportunity Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates , regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics. Desired Skills and Experience Cobol, Mainframe, AS400 & iSeries

Title: Solutions Architect
Salary: Competitive salary based on market rates, job responsibilities, and individual capabilities
Skills: Software Architecture, Cloud, CI/CD, DevOps, SQL
Description: About the job We are looking for the Solution Architect to join our Information Technology Division at Viettel Group. JOB DESCRIPTION: Research and evaluate trends in new technology and software architecture in the IT industry, propose applications, and develop roadmaps for the advancement of technology products, data platforms, AI/ML, or Cloud. Guide, design, and optimize the overall and detailed architectures of products, ensuring performance, consistency, stability, scalability, and integration between IT systems. Participate in building technology solutions and processes related to software development and production management. Support the development team in selecting appropriate technologies and solutions, ensuring connectivity and synchronization in IT system implementation. Research and evaluate solutions to optimize software development and deployment time using CI/CD and DevOps tools. Manage the quality of products and systems, establish measurement indicators, and propose improvements to optimize performance and ensure system efficiency while complying with quality standards and regulations. Develop and provide technical guidelines, optimizations, and standardizations for production management, system deployment, and operations. REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree or higher (with at least a “Good” classification) in Information Technology, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field. TOEIC ≥ 550 or an equivalent certification. Strong knowledge of data structures and databases (SQL and NoSQL). Proficiency in at least one programming language (Java, Scala, C++, C#, etc.). Understanding of design patterns and software architecture. Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD. Familiarity with big data management and modern data processing technologies. Solid understanding of distributed system design principles, Microservices, or Cloud-native architecture. Experience in designing architecture and developing software products, data platforms, Cloud, or AI/ML solutions. Strong research skills in technology and software architecture. Data modeling and database design skills. Effective communication, presentation, and visualization skills, with the ability to convey information concisely and clearly. BENEFITS Competitive salary based on market rates, job responsibilities, and individual capabilities Cash gifts during holidays, Tet, and the company’s founding anniversary, along with annual vacation support. Health insurance coverage, annual health check-ups at reputable medical facilities, and the opportunity to purchase health insurance for family members at discounted rates. Opportunities for training and working with experts domestically and internationally. OTHER INFORMATION Workplace: Ton That Thuyet St, Cau Giay Dist, Hanoi. Office hours: 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM, 1:30 PM - 5:30 PM from Monday to Friday. Email: tuyendung@viettel.com.vn

Title: Clinical Reviewer for Linguistic Validation in Clinical Trials
Skills: Japanese, Chinese, English, Communication Skills
Description: About the job Languages in Demand: Japanese Chinese Simplified Chinese Traditional Vietnamese Thai Overview: 1StopAsia is expanding its services to include Linguistic Validation for Clinical Trials, specifically targeting the translation and assessment of Patient-Reported Outcomes (PROs) into multiple Asian languages. This emerging sector has seen a marked increase in demand. As we aim to compete in a field currently dominated by major players, we are actively seeking a specialized Clinical Reviewer (CR) to join our team. Role: The Clinical Reviewer will play a critical role in the linguistic validation process by ensuring the clinical accuracy and relevance of translated medical documents. This position requires a deep understanding of clinical conditions relevant to each project, and the ability to provide insightful, detailed clinical feedback on translations. Responsibilities: Review translated clinical outcomes assessments and provide detailed clinical feedback Participate in discussions to ensure the translated content meets the required clinical standards and relevance Assist in the cognitive debriefing process by evaluating the readability and cultural appropriateness of translations Contribute to the documentation process, including the Clinician Review Report Ensure the integrity and clinical accuracy of the translations before final submission Requirements Native speakers of the target language Must reside in the country of translation Doctors, psychologists, psychiatrists, or clinical psychologists Ideally familiar with neuropsychiatry, Alzheimer's, or dementia domains Must be comfortable working in English-language review files (Excel) Excellent communication skills and attention to detail Benefits The opportunity to join a growing company venturing into a niche, high-demand area of translation Competitive compensation Flexible, remote work arrangements Engage with cutting-edge clinical trials and contribute to the development of global healthcare outcomes

They play a key role in driving digital transformation with a strong footprint in Europe and rapid global expansion. Their company culture is built on openness, curiosity, innovation, and integrity — values they seek in every new team member.
